We upgraded our room to a sea view and it was 100% worth the money. Breakfast is simple but appreciated as the portions in restaurants are huge and sometimes you just want something more continental. There was some sort of vent fan running on the roof above our room, which had the low-humming sound of a large truck idling outside our room. There was no way to turn this off. The fireplace is probably a hazard. It was emitting heat but had no pilot light. My husband had to ask them to come into the room to completely disconnect it for fear our family would die of carbon monoxide poisoning in our sleep. There is no counter space to speak of in the bathroom, nor are there any towel bars whatsoever. There is no decor in the rooms.

Summary: If you are looking to stay right on the beach in the heart of the action, this hotel is for you. It is not peaceful but it is right across the parking lot from the pier and the water. The hotel could stand some cosmetic renovation but the service was excellent - from the desk agent to the valet who handled everything from the luggage to bringing the car up. The continental breakfast was uninspired. It wasn't perfect but I would stay at this hotel again.

We've been spending a night or two at the Balboa Inn for the holidays for perhaps 10 years now. We love the location, proximity to many of our favorite haunts. This year in particular, I was impressed with the amount of kind and attentive service we received from the staff. Everyone seemed genuinely interested in us enjoying ourselves, which we did. It's definitely worth the extra money to get a room on the beach side of the hotel with a view, rather than a smaller room across the patio. We'll be back next year

Summary Heading: Good place to stay a night or two

Summary Heading: So Much Going For it - But Misses the Mark
Summary: I just completed a 4-night stay at Balboa Inn.    This IS a great location.  If you want to be in the mix and in the action and right next to everything there is to do....this is your place.  The beds are fine.  Main complaints:    The phones in the room don't work.  I get that everyone has a cell phone -but why have a phone in the room?  Hot tubs are dirty with floating bugs and tons of sand - all common areas need to be swept and hosed down.  A live plant or two would do wonders.   The rooms are minimally clean except the floors (tile).  I needed to wipe up wet footprints so someone didn't slip and fall and the towel I used was BLACK from all the grime on the floor.  Our shower had a massive roach in it.  The "breakfast" is very sub par.   The front desk team is super lazy.

Summary: The staff was super friendly but my hotel room badly needed walls painted, carpet cleaned and furniture repaired. For the steep room price you do not get a nice common area or even a big lobby to hang out in. The free breakfast (long table with coffee, fruit, OJ, packaged sweet roll and cereal) was downstairs in the loneliest, dark area, with heat lamps and dirty patio chairs. The Balboa Inn was well kept and the staff was fantastic.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  The location was perfect and it was very peaceful.  The only negative thing was the frosted glass bathroom door in our room. However, the staff are not professional, and are fake nice. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Plenty of public parking, but just for 2 hours during the day, so you have to get up early to be by the machine at 8 a.m.

Balboa Inn is a quaint hotel located on the Balboa Peninsula! Our family has stayed at the location a couple of times but it was for the location - not the property. It is an older hotel that has been ravaged by the elements of being located near the ocean. The location is fantastic. It was only a few steps to the pier, Ruby's Diner, the playground, and the beach. It is in the middle of all the action. We at breakfast and dinner at Ruby's and then at Mexican food right across the street. If you stay there, just do not expect a hotel with all of the modern amenities but you can expect a great location!

Summary Heading: Location, views and fantastic Customer Service!

We needed an additional room,  the gentleman at the desk was so kind and gave us a great price. Knowing that we were tired, he walked us to the rooms and gave us great advice on the best parking immediately near the hotel so we didn't have to pay for valet.  Room 1:  family room, perfect for our son and his family. The room did show a little wear, the table was peeling, but it was very clean the beds were comfortable. The staff was really friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the desk in our room was falling apart.  Besides that, a near perfect stay with the great smell of the ocean first thing in the morning off our balcony.

Itâ€™s fun casual hotel right in the middle of everything. Itâ€™s not fancy but perfect for a beach vacation  They have beach chairs and umbrellas plus fresh baked cookies. Itâ€™s kind of like going to grandmas.

We stayed at the balboa inn for couple of nights. We were told that we would have a balcony at reservation but when we checked in no balcony were with the room. I came back downstairs and the lady at the reception (Michelle) got it sorted and been very understanding. One of the best customer service. We then had Jose the valet helping us with the car and the luggage super friendly. At the end we were in a really nice room with balcony and enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Easily the most frustrating customer service experience I've ever had
Summary: Sometimes, when things have gone wrong, all you (as a service provider) need to say is, "I'm sorry this happened, I'm not sure why it did, but let us do everything we can to make this better."    If you are looking for anything close to this level of treatment, spend your money elsewhere.  I hoped my anger would fade away over time at this place, but almost five months later I'm just as upset.  My cousin was getting married in late April of 2017, and he asked me to Officiate the wedding.  The family chose the Balboa Inn and set aside a block of rooms there.  I called the hotel about 6 weeks before the ceremony, spoke to a clerk there, and requested an upgraded room.  I gave a credit card number and received a PDF confirmation to my email address.  I thought everything was good

We stayed at the Balboa and because of its close proximity to the Catalina Flyer so that we could go to Catalina for the day for that purpose this hotel is perfect you can get a two day parking pass for $24 at Balboa beach. And it's an easy walk to both Balboa inn and the Catalina Flyer. The inn at best is 2 Star the mattress was old and saggy the room look like it'd been painted by children the bathroom although spacious had no counter space and poor lighting at the sink. the staff was very friendly don't even bother with the free breakfast but the rooms were quiet and we got a good nights rest before our trip.

We have stayed here a couple of times.  It's all about the location!   They will park your car and you are within a short walk to beach, fun zone and the Balboa Island ferry.  Restaurants are close too.  The pier is right in front of the hotel too.  The rooms are just ok but the staff make up for it.   A continental breakfast is also included.  No pool, 2 very small jacuzzis.  Take your bicycle with you, the hotel is also on the bike path!

For my wife's birthday she wanted to escape SLC and get to the beach. The Balboa Inn was perfect for us. Located right in front of the pier, it was only a minute from the beach and water. The staff here was VERY friendly and helpful. The timing may have played into our favor, but the hotel was very quiet and private. We enjoyed our stay very much.

This hotel was so close to the beach, 3 star for the amazing staff, especially in housekeeping, very honest. Left my Iphone by the jacuzzi and staff turned it in.   I would recommend this hotel only if you want a get away to the beach, a few steps away to bars, restaurants, shops pier and to the balboa pavilion.   Room too small, too pricey but i guess we paid for being right in the beach. We didn't like the half wall shower coz floor gets so wet with water after shower.

This hotel is  overpriced & rundown. With the valet parking and Resort fee, it cost us $525 per night. The exterior of the hotel looks nice, however, the rooms are old, rundown, and in dire need of repair. The air conditioning in our room did not work, the thermostat was broken, the bathroom was extremely dark, the main room was extremely dark, the walls were nicked and scraped, the baseboards were coming apart, the carpet and furniture was stained, excetera. I have done extensive traveling and I have never been in a hotel that was this expensive yet this dumpy. To make matters worse, the hotel is on Main Street, which is across from several bars, and there is a lot of noise at night coming from the bars and from people on the street. I would absolutely NOT recommend staying at

Poor management. Lack of a real nice room design. Leaky faucets. Wouldn't be so bad if they didn't charge an arm and a leg to stay there, but the "resort fee" was pretty much the last straw. Trust the other reviews, definitely better places in NB for cheaper

Summary Heading: Horrible Customer Service.  They just want your money after that you are on your own.
Summary: Myself and my son went their for a fishing trip.  During our stay the hotel had a wedding and basically a all night party.  In our hallway their was basically a swap meet going on.  We called 5 times that night to the front desk and security until 3am.  We finally had to leave. They hotel refused to issue a refund and many many calls.  Just getting them to call back was impossible.  I travel the world and this was hands down the very worst experience I have ever had in a hotel.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: Nice, and lots of eye candy
Summary: We've been here a few times and it's always fun, and the renovations make it even nicer!  You're right in the middle of it all, so if you don't like crowds stay away, but if you do this is the place.  The new windows even let you close out the constant weekend noise, if you want to!!!!

Think again.  This place is a dump.  Honestly, this hotel has nothing going for it.  The free breakfast is a pot of luke warm coffee with a bowl of fruit for all guest to share, served on a pull out table in a run down hallway.  Couple that with a room that is falling apart: Picture an extension cord running up the wall to give the wall mounted AC unit and the TV power and you are on the right track. The bathroom is an adventure, the paint is falling off the walls, the soap dish look more like a petri dish and if you can work out how to control the hot and cold water you a better person than me. Almost forgot the wifi...its crap!  You'll also love it when you check out and learn that the "free" refilled VOS water, the nofi and breakfast all comes at the "free" rate of $22 a day

I scheduled this room for me, my mom and my two kids. We love Balboa island and have been coming every summer. This hotel was a terrible experience. The total cost with all the hidden fees ended up being $400 per night-which would have been ok if the hotel wasn't disgusting. Literally, the walls have chipped paint, the cheap furniture is peeled, the grey walls and terrible views are depressing, there were ceiling leaks, and you could literally see the dirt on the pillows etc. It was disturbing. If the cost was $100 per night we would have stayed and just tried to spend most of our time enjoying Newport. However for $400 per night it was shameful. We showed the front desk person pictures and his reply was that we could go somewhere else. The hotel was so gross that I actually

We stayed at the Balboa Inn this past weekend, 6/10/2017. Horrible experience & way over priced for the whole experience!!! NEVER EVER again...   We live locally - but have always wanted to stay here because it just looked so adorable and fun.  It has a bungalow setting with cobblestone walkways, thick adobe style walls, looks very Italian vintage ambiance appeal. Located on the corner in one of the busiest parts of Newport/Balboa.  Great location for being close to all the action, definitely.  Just a short walk away from the pier, the ferry, Fun Zone, food, bars and shops!  Couldn't pick a better location, really. Bed was fine but everything else was a rip off. Place needs major overhaul. Too prices for what we got. Breakfast was served in a stable, toilets disgusting and whole experience was very poor. Left after one night.

The staff were excellent but facilities are really old and a revamp is required!! We were only there for one night but we would not have stayed longer.  We had a room with a view but that is were it ended!

Being a huge Trip Advisor user, I read the reviews of this hotel before I booked it and if I had gone just on the reviews I would have never booked it.  But I did and was not disappointed.  The hotels location makes up for a lot of other things that aren't as high on my list as some.  The cleanliness of the room was good and the bed was very comfortable, but it was a regular sized bed.  My wife walked into the room and said " what size of bed is that?"  I said I believe that is the intimate size!  The bed fit the room.  The hotel had a great spa hot tub area, it is located on the second level and looks at the ocean. Not a good biz hotel. There was a desk but no chair?  Kind of creepy hallways. Hotel rooms are inside, but that are open walkways and stairs exposed to outside.  The bed was incredible though and would love to know what mattress that they use.

I would like start by saying that I don't usually like to waste my time writting bad reviews . I would much rather bring attention to business's that are doing a great job. However when a business has been as underhanded and shady in its policies as the Balboa Inn I feel it should be brought to the attention of other travelers so that there well earned vacation time is not a fiasco.     I was looking for a place that was above the usual , a weekend at the beach in a luxury hotel. I researched several hotels in the Newport beach , Huntington Beach area. My Boyfriend & I just recently stayed at the balboa inn and oh my god we were so happy with everything, the service was awesome everyone was extremely nice and helpful!!Happy with the room we had a beautiful view everything was awesome, We would absolutely come back and stay here again..

We visited while they were renovating the lobby, so it was crammed into an office area, which was fine.  We had 2 beds, which were separated by a wall, to offer some privacy.   Our flight arrived early morning and even though our room wasn't ready, we were able to leave our luggage and start touring the town.  Within walking distance to shops and restaurants.  The breakfast was a bit disappointing.

Great location, redone lobby but the rest is a bit shabby and not worth the price.  The phone in my room did not work and there was complete indifference on the part of management. In the off season the property has a bit of a creepy feel.

Summary Heading: Half the quality for twice the price
Summary: We recently stayed at Balboa Inn and as previously stated the rooms were clean and location was great for the beach and whale watching tours. The resort fee of $15 per night will be charged and discussing with front desk is useless. He stated it was for breakfast ( which is a joke with prepackaged rolls and apples) and for wifi and both were stated they were included in my booking and documented on paper. He then said the city collects this fee. Something kinda shaky here. But otherwise the hotel does have great location. Only one chair available to sit in for two bed rooms as the one we were in was two separate rooms with a shared bath and the view outside of brick wall which is what it is. Parking is $18 day and isn't far to walk.

We always go back to what we love! The Balboa Inn is a gift. We are always greeted by the warm friendly  staff.The sunshine is hot, the surf is up, the oceanviews are breathtaking and the rooms are cozy and clean, We relaxed on the beach and enjoyed the seafood platter at Siena Restaurant with a lovely glass of wine, We walked everywhere and were so happy to come back to our room and relax on the balcony watching the beautiful sunset. We will be back.. again, Love! Love! Love!

We were coming to Newport Beach to watch the Newport Beach boat parade and to go on a boat excursion the next day.  Called the Balboa Inn and got a cheaper rate than online but still was not worth it in terms of the hotel accommodations, but the location was great for the things we wanted to do around town.  The hotel is minimalist.  We needed a room with two beds.  We barely had enough extra plugs to charge our phone, we unplugged the TV in order to charge our two phones.  The beds were very comfortable but the room itself was in dire need of an upgrade as things were old, they were not into energy conservation and the area outside of the room which was on the 2nd floor was like being on a roof and was very unattractive.  The weather had changed and it was a bit chilly in the

We booked a "standard" room for Saturday and Sunday night for the weekend of the Newport Beach Holiday Boat Parade. The Balboa Inn is the perfect location for not having to move your car once parked. Walking distance to multiple eateries and the waterfront to watch the parade. The room we got was small but adequate. Some annoying flaws in the room include no power outlet on one side of the bed which make device charging difficult. The are no towel bars in the bathroom to hang towels on except for the one attached to the shower. So, no place to put a hand towel or wash rag or to put your clothes while showering. Not even a hook on the back of the door. The bedside lighting is too dim to read and the overhead lights are too bright to withstand. The bed is comfortable and the view

As a surprise I had given my partner a one night stay at this Inn for the boat parade.  I was pleasantly surprised to find the property very close to the pier and beach and very convenient to all the events in downtown.   I do have to say I felt a little misled in that I had assumed that we could walk out of the door onto the beach and that was not exactly true.  I had also assumed the breakfast was a normal breakfast which is a big deal to me but that turned out to be packaged pastries OR apples.    The rate was fair for an event and the staff was young but attentive.  It was a pleasant experience not 5 star but pleasant.

Summary Heading: Stay anywhere else other than here
Summary: I booked this room because we were coming back from Catalina on the ferry and this was within walking distance. I paid for an upgraded room  (290.00 total with the stupid 15.00 resort fee) so we were really looking forward to a nice stay in a nice room. I travel every week for work and was blown away on how bad this room was. We should have stayed in a Super 8 and it would have been better. I should have checked the reviews here on trip adviser instead of the reviews on the hotel website.    When we walked in the room i felt like we were in a closet instead of a room it was so small. Summary Heading: Good Location, but overall a terrible experience!
Summary: First of all, the place was hard to find, and once we found it, couldn't find a place to park to go in and register. They charged $45.00 per night for a truck to park on their property. A Valet told us we could park across the street by the beach in a city parking lot that was only $18 dollars a day. The room was the smallest room that I've ever stayed in. And the bathroom was very small also. We stayed three days with several family members. The first day, my wife was taking a shower, and I was lying on the bed, the maid just opened the door, without knocking. I was embarrassing for her, I guess. The Italian restaurant was basically outside. The continental breakfast was also outside, and consisted of packaged muffins and sweet rolls, with coffee, juice and milk. The only good

We stayed there primarily for the location (were going on a fishing tour very early) and found it to be very well located for other things as well (walk to the ferry, Balboa Pier, etc.).  But as mentioned by others, it is a bit awkward as it is actually 2 buildings that are linked and there is no parking.  They have valet in their (almost) underground parking ($35 per day?), but we parked in the public lot right next door (also paid, but more like $18 per 24 hours).  The room was clean and seemed to have been recently remodeled.  The bathroom was up to date.  The room was a little small and the lighting was not very "friendly."   The complimentary breakfast was a bit skimpy, if you're a big breakfast fan.

Difficult to find the lobby, located on a one way system and so circling around was difficult. No parking unless you paid to park in their parking lot!!!  I drive an SUV so it was $45, beach parking (which was very close by) was much cheaper but because I had my two grandchildren, strollers and cases we paid for parking....total rip off! Summary Heading: OK but probably wouldn't stop again.
Summary: This is a strange hotel with a weird internal layout. It is also pretty hard to find when driving, as in there is nowhere to park near to the reception so you end up circling around until you manage to find out that you either pay $35 for the hotels  parking or pay for the public car park.  Check in was ok, the guy was friendly enough but it seems that there are currently renovations so you have to walk through a courtyard and near to the bar/restaurant for check in. The room was decent enough and seemed as though it had recently been renovated. However the pool area is small and nothing like the pictures when booking.  We did have a comfortable bed and a decent sleep but I wouldn't stop again because of the parking charges,and difficulty in parking, and also because the

I stayed here in late September 2016.  The room was on the beach/resort side overlooking the water, but had the public parking lot situated between us and beach.  The room was comfortable, the bed solid.  Had a large screeen TV and a nice patio off the room with full sized door leading to it.   We didn't eat at the hotel, but the Italian restaurant and bar looked upscale. The lobby/check in room was under renovation and moved to a small room in courtyard.  The continental breakfast was adequate, coffee, tea, wrapped muffins, juice and fruit.   I really liked the grounds with all their statues and benches.  Overall, nice place to stay.

Had a room on the third floor with a terrace that overlooked the ocean and pier. Would have been great to leave the French doors open, but the nearby HVAC unit made that impractical due to the noise. Room was small, but OK. Bathroom had a funky odor and oddly placed windows. Bathroom sink faucet handles leaked and there was a leak under the vanity as well.  Location is terrific, in the downtown Balboa area. Ferry to Catalina is 2 blocks away. There are some nearby restaurants and bars. The place is currently remodeling and is a little confusing to locate temporary lobby. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Our stay at the Balboa Inn was better than average but I wouldn't consider it "very good".  The Balboa Inn is very old (the walls in our room were lap and plaster as opposed to drywall for example).  The carpet in the room was old and stained.  The maintenance work was hap-hazard at best (One of the plates for a light switch was secured to the wall crooked; a caulking job in the bathtub was done 3/4 of the way down the seam then stopped).  The balcony was deep enough for one chair and one small table, no room to walk around unless you wanted to walk from one end to the other. Figuring out where to park was also tricky. Went back to this hotel after 8 years and it's still the same. Needs some serious updating and care. Bought the best room in the "Resort" side so that helped a bit.   If you can get a top room on sale do it but other than that there are better value in Newport Beach

Upon arrival the price for our room price was higher than quoted.    Everything, I mean everything needs a scrub brush and some TLC.  It's tough to pay for Valet parking and have your car come back covered in bird poop!  The breakfast is free but....the least they could do is provide a nice presentation, pastries in plastic wrappers and old fruit not very appetizing.   Our room was ok, but forget sleeping in.  5 star price for a 2 star hotel.

My sister and I wanted to get away for the weekend, and some website she found gave this horror five stars, which would be like giving a pothole a perfect score.  The Balboa Inn is the worst hotel either of us have ever stayed in.    This hotel is on the other side of a huge public parking adjacent to the Balboa Pier, so you are not "on the water" by any means.  We were supposed to have a view room, but our windows faced away from the parking lot; all we could see from the window were black awnings covered with bird poop across a narrow courtyard. Summary: Expensive hotel but understandable because their location which is really close by (walking distance) of the pier. Reserved an ocean view room but when checked into our room its was Remotely/PARTILY ocean view. other stuff were involved too when by the pool one of the teenagers started smoking a joint but by the time he reached the half of it I believe a security showed up. I understand its probably a family run business but honestly the management needs to hire an experienced hotel manager to step up their game a little (No disrespect or personal feelings .. it just the way it is) Still Love the place though :)

Summary Heading: Great location but that's about it......
Summary: Great location but hotel needs some serious updating and cleaning.  The good.... the location is perfect for anything you want to do in Balboa...... beach, restaurants, Fun Zone, people watch, etc.  We paid for the ocean front room which was nice you could sit outside on the patio and enjoy a evening cocktail while watching the sunset.  The bad..... the room was really dirty, hair on the floor in the bathroom, mold around the tub, room reeked of dog urine, old makeup on the walls in the bathroom, etc. etc.  It was pretty bad.  I know you are paying for the location but that only goes so far.  The patio furniture in the "pool" area was worn out, dirty and torn.  This could be an exceptional property if updates, cleaning and maintenance were done.  I don't mind paying the price

This hotel is very over priced for what they offer....room totally Substandard...when I complained they offered to uber me to Marriott....bad management...will never stay here ever again. At the bar wine was bad... bartender gave me attitude. Manager gave me cheap bottle of wine for free...wow

If you can get this hotel for under 100.00 the go ahead for one night it's fine.  We had just finished a cruise and wanted to spend a day at the beach they had one two bed available. The room had been remodeled not well but remodeled. not sure how you do an upgrade and the leave a toilet seat circa 1980 remaining in the bathroom dis colored and chipped. Ugh what is management thinking. The bed was ok, just ok.  For 345.00 dollars just say NO. We were given a discount for the Italian restaurant on property. We went in at 1pm not one person dining. Summary: Some of the people traveling in my group seemed to get the more recently renovated rooms, but mine was a different story - and for the same price.  Just very, very overdue for an update. I'm pretty sure the walls hadn't been cleaned or painted in 20 years. A fresh coat at least would work wonders. Outdated fixtures and paper thin walls aside - there were just so. many. cosmetic issues that I believe could be easily addressed to make the room (217) not as much of a disappointment to walk into.   - Towels were all different shades of beige, and one had a blue stain all over it that had to have been obvious to whoever laid them out.  - Black scuff marks allllll over the walls & baseboards - they seriously needed some Magic Eraser rehab. - Holes and peeling paint all on walls.  -

Booked this hotel on-line because of the location. It advertised free wifi, free breakfast, outdoor pool and parking on site. When we arrived, we could not find the lobby or the parking area. Finally someone came around and told us where the lobby was and where to leave our car. At check-in, they informed us there was a resort fee to pay, even though I had prepaid the advertised price on-line.   There was no pool on site, only an oversized hot tub. The room was terrible, no decorations, small and dingy. The bathroom was very small and had no counter space at all. Breakfast the next morning should NOT be considered a 'continental' breakfast as advertised. There were some packaged muffins, some orange juice and bad coffee. Flies all around. Summary Heading: Not worth the $$$ even with the beach location.
Summary: The outside looks decent but pass this one up. The hotel is a 2 min walk from the catalina flyer and balboa fun zone and pretty much on the beach but it is horrible. We walk in a room with a guy sitting at the desk, no greeting, we had to ask if were were in the right place. He had me sign a paper saying I would pay tax and an $15 resort fee but did not say what it was (I knew because I read it on the website). He handed me a key and directed us to our room. No help with bags offered so not sure if they have anyone to help.  Got to our room which was very old looking about 6 windows with all blinds open, very musty we

Not a good hotel. The room was so small, and it was not in good condition. There were scratches on the walls, and the you can hear everything that goes on in the hallway. For the amount we paid we didn't even get a beach front view. The best thing about the room was the shower. I do not recommend. I would rather pay the same amount for a nicer hotel that is 10 minutes away.

Came to the beach for my birthday... Was treated horribly by Michelle(that's a dude btw)...broken windows... Broken Jacuzzi tub... No microwave... Treated rudely by staff... Dirty toilet...broken closet...And the room was not ready by their check in time... We are moving to a new hotel! Extreme overpriced!

We were a little disappointed with our stay here. The view was of a brick wall, and was on the noisy side. We were in room 202, and it was a little on the loud side. I believe there was a bar down below us. The bed was comfy, and the employees were nice. We were also disappointed that the restaurant was closed. We did have a wonderful meal down the street though. The location is great, but overall we were disappointed with our stay at the Balboa Inn.

Balboa Inn has so much going for it but misses the mark in some instances. It is right on the boardwalk and centrally located, which is awesome. You can literally park your car and not have to get in it again for the whole trip. You can walk to all kinds of restaurants, shopping and entertainment.   The rooms leave a little to be desired, in my opinion. There is nothing on the walls at all. Not a single, solitary picture or painting. You would think for the price you're paying, there'd be a little more dÃ©cor. Also, the bathrooms are tiny and not very well appointed.   Overall, it's a nice place to stay because of the location.

went there for the fishing trip and found this motel where I didn't have to drive to get there as well as the beach right there. big room, but terrible breakfast. really not a breakfast at all. stale danishes. fireplace was nice if it had worked and no light in the room. only lamps on the nightstands. so very dim in there. asked for help to do either one of them to work but to no avail. not worth 250 a night. would defineatly try another place next time

I spent two nights there and the accommodations were quite nice.  The staff is very cordial and the owner quite friendly as well, very laid back.  You can't go wrong if you love the beach!  They have cafes and restaurants all over the area and a nice little bike shop adjacent to the facility with some really interesting rentals.

Summary Heading: Great location, not so great neighbors
Summary: Balboa Inn has a lot of potential with its prime location to walk/bike to nearby beaches, shops and restaurants. Very cute on the outside and room was recently renovated but.....Toilet barely flushed and only two bath towels provided for our family suite. When I asked housekeeping for two more towels I was told no and we had to find other staff to get us towels. The first night was fine,walls are thin and you could hear the people walking in halls and mumbled voices. Then there was night 2&3. At 1am loud music and many youth decided it was a good time to start a party on our floor. This is a great hotel in an excellent location to beach and to the balboa island ferry, good value for money and staff are helpful and friendly, breakfast is small but enough to get you started there are plenty of cafe nearby to get hot cooked breakfast of all descriptions, there is a restaurant on ground floor of hotel food was good but we found it expensive, would recommend this hotel not the fanciest I've stayed in, but we stayed for location not the decorations, would definitely stay again x

Summary Heading: Paid a lot, got very little.
Summary: Jacuzzi tub didn't work. Lobby was impossible to find. Room needed more detailed cleaning. Management needs to fully inspect rooms more frequently. It's kinda ridiculous that there are ice containers but no ice machines.

We recently visited Newport Beach/Balboa Village for a quick 2 night-off season mini-vacation.  We were able to check in a little early at the Balboa Inn and were given a nice room, #208, with a king-size very comfortable bed and a small balcony above the side street where you could see a sliver of ocean and watch people meander by.  Check in was easy but I wish hotels that have "resort fees" would just add it into the cost of the room.  It is uncomfortable for the staff to try to explain what it covers and annoying to the customers if they did not notice the additional cost on the website.  Nevertheless, overall we were happy with the cleanliness of the room, the staff friendliness and the perfect location. The bike/pedestrian path is feet from the front door and two doors down

Immediately upon walking in, the room smelled musty, the paint is peeling on the walls and no art work is hanging. I usually am not very picky on places to stay(I've slept in tents in jungles) but this does not meet expectations. Great location but I'm glad this is just for one night

Summary Heading: Holiday Stay at the Balboa Inn
Summary: We flew down on Christmas Eve to visit family. My mother, boyfriend and I all stayed at the Balboa Inn and had two rooms on the second floor. Our checkin process was a bit awkward, the man helping us, Kyle was not friendly at all. He requested a lot of additional information from us and when we asked why there would be an additional $15 "resort fee" he shrugged his shoulders and had a lame excuse. The way he treated us rubbed my family the wrong way for sure.  Our rooms were recently renovated. Small, but clean and modern. Found it strange artwork was missing on all of the walls. Water in our shower wouldn't get past lukewarm. King bed was really comfortable. We all slept extremely well!   The breakfast provided downstairs is nothing more than coffee, tea, apples and packaged

You couldn't get any better location. Right by restaurants, the boardwalk, beach and Balboa Island. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious with an ocean view. A breakfast of pastries and fruit was included.  We went down for the boat parade and found we could walk to it and the parade and fun activities for our 6 year old did not disappoint.  The room had a fireplace that didn't work and the room could be updated or rather some rehab. A little "worn". Overall great!!

needed a nice room for an overnight stay, arrived late and left early. Staff very nice and polite. Room small but clean, looked newly remodeled. comfy bed with down comforter. Nice stand up shower with rain head feature.

Summary Heading: So Sad!  Motel 6 has better hotels.
Summary: We stayed at the Balboa Inn for 2 nights.  What a disappointment!  We reserved 2 adjoining "junior suites".  They were adjoining but not sure about the definition of "suite".  One room had a couch/sofa bed and a bit of extra room.  The other was a basic room but had the only refrigerator.  Bathrooms were really bad.  Brass fixtures were old had "bled" rust.  No hot water in the sink.  Peeling paint in all rooms.  Basically, the place needs to be gutted.    Outer architecture is wonderful but Motel 6 has better rooms. (we've stayed in many of them on recent cross-country road trips).  Staff was friendly and helpful.    Breakfast is juice, coffee and packaged pastries.    The location, right on the beach, is fantastic but not worth the price.

Deciding to take a last minute reprieve from the heat in Los Angeles, I stumbled upon a beautiful, cozy and cheerful hotel for a two day vacation.  It was exactly what the doctor ordered.  A gorgeous property steps from the water with beautiful sunsets and plenty of activities when I chose to leave the property for a bicycle ride or exploring.  My room faced the ocean with a large private terrace for some good book reading, along with an amazing jacuzzi tub bathroom that would make any spa aficionado very envious.  I would recommend the filet mignon with mushroom gravy highly for dinner.  Finished the evening off at their sports bar with a dirty martini and some new found friends watching football. Love this place!

My husband and I were looking for a place to take Mom away for a weekend to celebrate her 89th birthday.  She loves Balboa Island so we thought the Balboa Inn would be perfect.  It is walking distance to the ferry to get across to Balboa and right near the beach.  Unfortunately it was not what we hoped for.  The hotel is restored from 1929.  We were expecting period furnishings but instead what we found were modern IKEA furnishings.  The one plus about this is the bed was confortable.  The rooms are small and unattractive and they use extremely noxious cleaning products to clean the floors etc in the rooms so bad that we literally had to open the windows and leave for several hours.  The view was non existent and very noisy.  The restaurant on site -- an Italian restaurant was

We were really excited to stay in this nice hotel on the sand with a great bar and a fabulous Italian restaurant.  Checked in to find it was an additional $35 a day to park the car, plus a $15 resort fee, which brought the room fee up to $400 a night.  Then saw the room, which was not nearly as nice as a Motel 6, and had a lovely view of a brick wall which immediately gave you claustophobia.  The TV remote didn't work, the bedside lamp didn't work, there was no chair just hassocks which made it uncomfortable to be in the room.  Went down to the bar to find it closed with no plans to open, and then found the restaurant was not opening.  The surrounding areas "fine dining" options consisted of a very small and abreviated menu at BJs, or a bar with all you could eat tacos for $6.

Summary Heading: Most disgusting place I've ever seen!
Summary: Maybe a portable toilet is more disgusting but I doubt it. Big pool of water in the room from our non working fridge. They took us to 3 different rooms before we found one where the toilet actually flushed. Pee stain on the mattress pads. Housekeeping did NOT change this when I complained at the front desk. No art on the walls and with the gray paint I felt like I was in some type of institution. Lovely view of rooftops which were in urgent need of repair and mold in the tile shower floors. We had to climb over mops in the corridor to get to our room. This place is downright NASTY for over $250/night!

Summary Heading: Great location but not worth the price
Summary: First of all I am not used to spending $500+ a night for a room but we did since it was our anniversary. The location of the hotel was perfect if you enjoy the hustle and bustle of a crowded beach resort. We valet parked our car for $35 and did not need it until we left. Everything was within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Max the bellhop/valet. Unfortunately I felt the room was not what I expected for the price. The bed was small for 2 people (I think it might have been a full) although comfortable. The furniture was old and chipped. There were no extra blankets in the room. I couldn't sleep and moved in the middle of the night to the couch and had to use a bathrobe (which was provided in the closet) as a blanket. Bottled water in the room cost

Summary Heading: Things are not how they use to be...
Summary: First I want to say we have stayed here in the past and Loved it ...every year we go to Balboa rent a home we have dinner here at Balboa Inn with our entire family usually between 10-15 of us ...this trip was only my husband and I . Upon our arrival we were greeted by a woman named Michelle which was very rude to my husband.. we dismissed her rude remarks we went to our room which was suppose to be ocean view instead it was view of the bar and side walks she told my husband maybe next time we can have the better view even though thats what we were told we rented ...we decided to go have dinner  at the restaurant which we have always loved ...we waited to be seated  a guy that didn't speak english very well  pointed to a table we waited for a server for about 10 min finally a

My daughter and I travel to Southern California every summer to celebrate her birthday and have mom and daughter bonding. We have stayed at many wonderful beaches and hotels including Loews in Santa Monica. The Balboa Inn is our favorite so far. Here's why. The people who run the Inn are friendly and accommodating, especially Laura. The rooms are beautiful, at least the two we were shown. We chose one looking straight at the ocean and pier. It was an upgrade from our original, but reasonable and worth it. We could see the Pacific from every window in our room.The location is prime--steps to beach and pier and good restaurants including the one at the Inn.  We also enjoyed the wonderful huge hot tub overlooking the ocean every night.Only two blocks from the adorable

We reserved our room in April 2015 through TripAdvisor.com, had our 5-day stay comfirmation in hand on July 11th when we checked in. Very rude man at front desk said we still owed $110.00 per day...said our TripAdvisor.com charge of $189.00 per day UNDER CHARGED US $110.00 per day, that our room was ACTUALLY $289.00 per day. We refused to pay more, and demanded Balboa Inn hold to our prepaid comfirmation...after much anger & bickering, we won. There is no place to park while checking in or unloading luggage, except in the left lane of Main St. blocking traffic...very stressful, as the street is very busy. Parking is $30.00 to $10.00 per day, depending on where you park. Our room was not ready when we checked in, we had to wait 45:minuets. Staff is very helpful, and kind...front

We loved the hotel.  Right in the middle of it all.  Step out the door, to the left for the harbor, to the right for the pier and beach.  what more could you ask for.  staff was attentive and friendly and professional.  room was everything we needed.  wifi was week but who would be trying to "connect" during vacation?!!!  not me!!

our first time at this hotel and there was a lot of traffic due to the holiday week end,  we had passed by the valet, circled around the block and pulled up in their driveway and my husband walked around to the front he didn't see it but found the garage/valet came to the gate in front of where I had parked waiting for him, he said he couldn't find no one so my husband called the front desk to let him know where we were, the Attendant finally came to our rescue let us in parked the car for us and took us to the front desk, he said the valet is on the street (2lanes) ok to park in front of the hotel for the valet, we got there early at 1:30,  hotel check in is at 4:00 the clerk (owner) said our room should be ready at 2:30 so we went to their restaurant bar had lunch checked in

Summary Heading: good location but not worth the money
Summary: the ONLY good part about this hotel was that it was right on the beach but other than that there was no parking provided, rude staff, and they gave me a way smaller room than I booked and charged me the same amount for it. Also, being that the hotel was located right next to bars it was very loud until about 2 am so do not come here with young kids.

Summary Heading: Beach side accommodations and easy Catalina access
Summary: The Balboa Inn is located across the street from the Balboa pier and public parking, and just a block away from the Catalina Flyer terminal. It's location is convenient to local restaurants and the Balboa biking trail as well as being steps from the sand.   Parking was found at the beach. $15/day and it can get very crowded (especially weekend afternoons). Check in was fast and easy. I had a "deluxe" room on the second floor. The room was small, but suitable and had updated decor. The windows opened to the back alley of a restaurant. The deluxe feature I received was a fireplace (the website notes these rooms may have a fireplace, view or balcony). The bed was very comfortable and the toiletries a refreshing rosemary mint.   The closet was cedar lined, and a panel fell off in

I stayed at Balboa Inn with a friend for a relaxing spring break. The room seemed clean, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. We loved being so close to the beach, and right in the middle of dining and shopping (especially the cantina across the road). Quite the beachy experience! Our toilet clogged late one night, and the front desk was quick to help us take care of it.   I was disappointed with several things. The WiFi was expensive and not a strong signal, so trying to watch a late night movie on our laptop was frustrating. I felt the bathroom walls needed to be wiped down, although my friend didn't feel the same way. The ceiling fan had a half-inch layer of dust hanging from the blades. The worst part was the used condom we discovered

My husband and I stayed at the balboa inn for two nights, April 28-30. I liked everything about the hotel. It was quiet and pretty. The room was nice and the staff was very polite. I work at a hotel on the strip in Las Vegas and know a thing or two about customer service and the hospitality industry. I will definitely be going back. Forgot to mention I loved the short walk to the beach.

Had reservations to go to Catalina on the Flyer out of Newport Beach. Not wanting to drive from the Temecula area at o'dark early we decided to go the day before and find lodging nearby. Have wanted to stay at this property because it is close to the beach, the pier, the area  of the Balboa Fun zone where the Catalina Flyer docks. I was able to get the room at a 20% discount for the one night Tuesday to Wednesday. It was a king bed on the third floor. The walls are painted grey. Not even a pretty grey. There is more grey in that room than i have seen in a heavy fog. The pedestal that the mattress sits on is 2-3 inches too large and there is no bed spread. It probably would have been grey I'm sure. The television was off center to the right above the fireplace. The headboard was

The worst stay. Came here with my boyfriend and his daughter. They gave us a room right next to the loud restaurant called sienna that's located in the hotel. No privacy outside the window. Had to keep them closed. When we called the front desk to ask if we could switch to a more quiet room due to the loud patrons at the restaurant, the guy at the front desk said, "unfortunately I just went up to the restaurant and I didn't hear any noise so I won't be able to help you" ... And to make matters worse, there was no manager on duty supposedly so there was no way to escalate the complaint and come to a resolution. THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE! And on top of it all, our hotel room was located on the side of the "un-renovated" hotel. Our room was falling apart, the windows wouldn't open

Summary Heading: Small rooms, little amenities, noisy staff, only good thing is Location, location, location.
Summary: Room was very small, had no pictures or even a chair to sit in.  The bathroom was modern but the sink was so small you couldn't set you bag on it.  No free parking and at times you were locked out of the area to get to your car to feed the meter. Very noisy staff so you better be ready to get up at 6 am.  Staff is nice, but nickel and dime you to death.  It's all location, location, location being so near the beach...which is great, but for the money its not worth it.  It looks fantastic on the outside, but lacks a lot on the inside.  Very disappointed and will not stay there again.

What a weekend..We wanted to stay close to home, on the beach and we wanted to walk and ride bikes everywhere. We got so much more and I feel I must bragg about it. First, the staff was so warm and welcoming. Our room had a beautiful oceanview and balcony. (I am sure I saw some dolphins). The room was so cozy we didn't even want to leave. The sunken tub with a lovely glass of champagne and room service from "Siena" was exactly what we needed.The location is ideal and the hotel is so comfortable and clean.The Balboa Inn is truly a treasure. Everything was so good !We will be back!

Summary Heading: This is one of the most unsanitary hotels we have ever been to
Summary: We arrived in the evening after a full day of travel.  Tired. beat. and ready for a relaxed night of sleep.  On our way into the hotel there were three drunk dudes urinating in front of the hotel on the sidewalk.  We entered the lobby, a bit dirty, and smelly.  we had reserved a ocean view suite via amex travel.  We arrived to our room via a dirty and smelly elevator.  Entering the Suite, we found it was not a suite at all but rather a small room.  the view was hardly an ocean view.  our view was a 75 meter parking lot, then a hill of sand, then in the distance the ocean.  The room smelled bad.  The bathroom smell permeated the entire room (NOT SUITE).  the white grout was black, the tub had parts missing and panels falling off the side of it.  The waste basket had mold on the

Summary Heading: Small, poorly laid out noisy rooom
Summary: This was given to us as a gift, so awkward. It's looks acceptable on the outside, but inside the rooms have the room door next to the bed, so you hear every detail going on outside in the hall way. The bathroom was small, no view.   The staff was polite and provided a coffee make upon request.   The area is a fun area, the fun zone, the ferry and Pavillion with a great restaurant. There's no hotel parking, so you park on the public beach lot, so get ready to get up early in the AM to feed the meter. The hotel looks newer on the outside, but still a vintage property elsewhere.

Great value for price.  Right on Boardwalk and beach. Good staff and great value.  Decent restaurant and bar.  Wonderful area for walks and pets.  We had attractive view room.  Upgrades fall a little short (not enough outlets, short on furniture, no hair dryer, no pictures on wall).  For the price this was a great experience.  We would definitely return!

Summary Heading: Great Location closest to Balboa Island
Summary: Overall this hotel is pretty poor, however I gave it 3 stars because of the great location! It is within walking distance (literally across the street) from the Balboa Island Ferry, so if Balboa Island is your destination, this is the obvious choice, as there are no hotels on the island and this one is the closest.  The room was very small, and didn't even have a hair dryer, but we were only there to sleep, so it didn't really bother us.  Next time, I would for sure, ask for a room with a balcony.  It is within walking distance to many restaurants, bars and the Balboa Fun zone, and the only hotel on the sand at that end of the peninsula, so again, the location can't be beat. Bad thing was the ipod radio in the room's alarm kept going off every couple of hours all nite long, and

I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the the beach and local activities. I got exactly what I wanted, but please don't expect any extras. It's an older hotel, which I have great appreciation for, but it was unkept. We checked in late and the room was not well lit. We woke to a beautiful sunrise, but quickly discovered how dirty the room was. The tub floor felt as though it was going to cave in, so we had to "strategically" shower around the edges of the tub. You could literally hear the floor cracking under the tub and we're both average size people. The walls were filthy and the carpet wasn't too clean either. The continental breakfast was served on the same open patio that mounds of hotel garbage was stored. Overall, I love a bed and breakfast and the old charm of a

Summary Heading: great location if you want to be close to that part of beach, otherwise stay elsewhere
Summary: We specifically wanted to be near this pier as we have family close by so I was willing to overlook certain things. However, besides location and the hot tub I would pick another hotel. The parking is way over priced. At this price point I expect either a voucher for adjacent lot or something. We were able to park elsewhere but that was inconvenient. The pillows are horrible. A cheap Walmart pillow would have been better. The faucet in bathroom sink was awful, knobs turned wrong way and water just blasted out. We had a king bed with pull out love seat...this was ok for our young kids but adults would not be comfortable on the pull out. The continental breakfast was skimpy! So would I stay again? Yes but only because it is walking distance to family. If the family moves closer to

Very bad place to stay, would not recommend it at all.  The service is below par, the rooms are not as large or nice as the photos.  I asked for extra pillows and towels and they said "we do that've any", the AC and jacuzzi didn't work and it says panoramic view of the ocean which wasn't true.  Worst part was I asked for a "upgraded room" because we were unhappy, without explanation the front desk employee charged us for a an additional room instead of a upgrade price we negotiated.  Spent three hours arguing with Michelle the manager and he would not listen to reason and  insisted on charging us for 2 rooms even though we occupied only one.  Don't stay here!

Summary Heading: Great place, great price via online booking
Summary: We stayed at Balboa Inn during October 2014, family of 5 - 2 adults and 3 kids.  Central place to stay at Newport Beach, great bike rental next door. The location is just next to the pier and beach facilities. The place to relax, enjoying the Newport Beach enviroment and the local ferry just in walking distance to the Balboa peninsula and city, the great outdoor mall is short distance by taxi or car.  Unique, relaxing and great place to stay  I will be back soon :-)

I have lived in this area and thought it might be fun to go overnight just to see the Holiday Decorations. This was the Sunday after Christmas. The hotel is right smack in the middle of the Peninsula which made it very noisy. We asked for a Deluxe King and had to go through two rooms before finding a decent room (but with a futon sized full/queen bed). After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I expressly called back to make sure we had a good room as this was a partial Christmas present. We were assured we would be in the "newly remodled" room. First room..extremely unpleasant smell...sewage like. Second OK but not great. certainly not remodeled. The last room was good. Views of the parking lot then the ocean! Downside.. small bed, extremely thin walls so could hear next door

My wife and I stayed at the Balboa Inn for our anniversary.  We used to live on Balboa Island (across the bay and reachable by ferry that is a very short walk from the hotel) when we first got married, so we wanted to go to some of our favorite places where we used to go.  We read the reviews - good and bad - about this property and were a little leery of what we would find when we got there.  I will say that the hotel met my minimum standards - clean and comfortable enough.  And the location cannot be beat - a very short walk to the beach, the Balboa pier, the Balboa Island ferry and Pavilion.  In that regard, it was the perfect place for us to stay and go to all of our old haunts.  But some of the things that others mentioned - thin walls, noisy tile floors, no places to sit

This is the ideal location in the Balboa area of Newport Beach.Minutes away from the beach,the bay ,great restraunts, bars and shops.Staff was extremely friendly, rooms were small but clean.Would not hesitate to stay here again,highly recommend it especially if location us at the top of your priorities.

Summary Heading: Spend the extra money to go elsewhere
Summary: I'll start off first by stating, that I think if this were for couples, it might be OK. I'll start off with the first night we arrived, at about 8:30. There were no clear signs on where to park so I parked in the small beach parking lot; we arrived and the gentleman asked for a card. I gave him the card and explained that I wanted to put it on two different cards (me and my sister were splitting the hotel cost), and he said no worries, that the card was just taken for a hold. So they charged $10.00 - and told me I was to pay the balance when I check out... that's what I'm used to - so OK.... The room itself lacked decoration, and was secluded, so secluded, we had no service on our phones and could not connect to the wifi - no big deal about that... we're on vacation..who needs

This hotel and the wedding coordinator do not work together to provide a pleasant experience. The wedding was at the hotel and it was run poorly. They were putting down the aisle runner at the same time that they were trying to seat guests. The prime rib was quite small and dry and the presentation was not appealing. They started the toasts without pouring the champagne. They waited too long to cut the cake and then there was no offer of the leftover cake to be wrapped up to be sent home. It just seemed like this was their first wedding and they said that they had done several. There were a few other little irritating moments throughout the night, but I feel I have stated enough. I wouldn't stay there again or eat in their restaurant.

My friend and I checked into the Balboa Inn after a 16 hour flight from Dubai and two hour drive from LAX (traffic). The room was fairly small and we were concerned that it faced what looked to be a busy bar (Cabo Cantina). The cleanliness wasn't great also, there were some leftover hairs in the bathroom when we checked in! The location was nice next to the beach and there is public parking behind which is much cheaper at $15 for 24 hours rather than $34 at the hotel. At 1am in the morning we were both woken to screaming and drunk people from the bars overlooking the hotel. We rung reception to tell them that someone needed to have a word and get this noise sorted. We don't imagine we were the first or will be the last people to complain. The next day we told the lady in

Way overpriced for a "Suite" decorated like an episode from "The Golden Girls."  Mildew and grime on the shower walls, VERY thin walls and mediocre customer service.  There must have been a wedding reception directly beneath us because we were subjected to the thumping of horrible music and the boom over the mic from the DJ.  I have stayed in a Motel 6 nicer than this place.  Honestly.

Summary Heading: An old but elegant hotel in a prime recreational spot.
Summary: My wife and I spent two nights at the Balboa Inn in August, 2014 because it is a short walk from the Inn to the Catalina Flyer that goes to Avalon on Catalina Island.  Staying at the Inn before we went to Catalina made it easy to make a 9 AM sailing time on the way to a  five-night stay on Catalina, and staying at the Inn after the boat returned at 6 PM made it easy to make a 1 PM flight home the next day.  The Balboa Inn is an elegant place in the middle of the incredible environment on this part of the Balboa Peninsula of Newport Beach.  We stayed in the expensive rooms with a view of the Balboa Pier and ocean, and it was well worth the cost.  This is an old hotel and one should not expect the same pristine neatness of a Ritz Carlton or a Four Seasons hotel, but one can

Summary Heading: Shabby, dingy and a little smelly.
Summary: Such a disappointment!  I brought my mother her for her last trip to the sea (she passed of cancer 3 months later)  I chose this location because on the proximity to the water.  It's in a great location but that's where it ends.  The room looked like it had been furnished from a garage sale from 1980.  Even the towels were threadbare.  I was shocked at the price vs value and SO disappointed as I knew this would be moms last trip.  I had a drink at the bar and mentioned to the bartender how disappointed I was and she stated that she heard that a lot and recommend I check out Yelp and TA next time.  Boy was she ever right.  Pass on this one people.  It has a lot of potential if someone took the time and money to make it nice, but as for now.....ugh Never Again!

Summary Heading: The only thing good was the location!
Summary: Not even the beachfront location could overcome the mediocre facilities. We stayed in the remodeled section. It was poorly done, loose plumbing fixtures, missing grout in the shower, Hardly any drawer space. The continental breakfast seemed to be an afterthought, constantly running out of coffee, milk, and juices, etc. Several staff members were not helpful or very friendly. Seemed to be operating on a shoestring budget. Did I mention the location?

Summary Heading: Nice place if it were half the price
Summary: We booked at the Balboa Inn, even after reading quite a lot of negative reviews. I can see why the reviews were so bad. It is not a bad hotel, but, for the price--even at this location--you really would expect more. The room is small, but comfortable. Our room was on the 2nd floor and the restaurant is also on the 2nd floor--really bad planning. I suppose they were taking down tables, but for about an hour or two there was loud clanging and banging, just when we were getting ready for bed. Noisy guests are one thing, noisy staff quite another. The location is awesome and check-in smooth and easy, but we won't be staying there again.

Worst hotel experience of my life.  Poop in toilet upon arrival bad, RAT in room horrible, customer service atrocious.  My family (me, wife, 2 young daughters) had a large RAT in room 333 on late Saturday (August 2, 2014) night, early Sunday morning.  Management did NOTHING to rectify the situation.  In fact, I wound up cutting my vacation short by 2 days and driving my family home (Las Vegas) at 1:30 in the morning.  3 days after the fact, still no apology and they charged me for the night without providing an alternate room.    Full Story:  Initial booking was for Ocean View (upgraded price of $450).  The room was not an ocean view so I immediately called down.
