A friend raved about Balboa Island and suggested that we stay at the Balboa Inn on the peninsula.  Perhaps one of our mistakes was going on the July 4th weekend, when the Balboa area was overrun with the Great Unwashed.  But judging from the plethora of tee-shirt and tchotke shops, this area is just a tourist trap with expensive residences.  We checked in on a Sunday to the hotel's unassuming lobby (just a valet and one employee behind a small desk).  The common areas were bright and had some thoughtful design touches.  Our room had been renovated but was a little rough around the edges (plumbing fixtures weren't secure).  if there was a pool or restaurant, nobody bothered to show either to us.  That night we were awoken by drunken revelers in the halls and the following morning

Tried to have a quick 2 day relaxing trip with my family. Absolute horrible experience stay away. I called the hotel Monday the 23rd asking about the rooms the picture shows the family suite with an old style and an updated style. Laura had explained to me all rooms were remodeled so I went ahead and booked the room trusting her word. I show up with my family late probably about 10-1030Pm. I check in take my family to our room to find out the room had not been remodeled the fire place was broken with pieces hanging off of it. Spiders on the ceiling carpet stained old towels in the bathroom stained dirty air condition barely hanging on wall. I go down stairs to complain they move me to a room that is remodeled but 1bed so now my 4 kids have to sleep on the floor. We get into the

After reading reviews that were less than great , I went ahead and booked a two night stay at the Balboa Inn to take a fishing trip for my husbands birthday.  It was a wonderful experience!  Taking heed of some reviews, I booked a suite.  I was able to negotiate a fair price, and actually got the best room in the place!  The staff was extremely helpful and kind. The views and location are excellent.  I will certainly book another stay there when we go fishing again.  Thanks Balboa Inn for a lovely experience!

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting the sites
Summary: We loved being in such great walking distance to the Fun Zone, several restaurants and bars, bike rentals, and the whale watching opportunities,   Walked to both piers and spent time on the beach. The view from the Jacuzzi was lovely.   The parking was reasonable for the area--we self parked one car and used the valet for the other.

Just returned from a 4 day stay, reservation through booking.com. advertised free bike rental, breakfast, outdoor Jacuzzi, refrigerator inn room, restaurant and parking might have a fee!  No bike rental included, continental breakfast - not breakfast, Jacuzzi broke 3 of 4 days there, gave us a refrigerator last night, restaurant closed Monday and Tuesday, parking $45.00 per night. Mold on shower curtain.  Response from management and owners that were available around property - "THATS BOOKING.COMS PROBLEM!"  Thank god it was my 19th anniversary and not my 20th! there are 3 other hotels in Newport all for the same price and all have better management.
Manager Response: The customer was booked for a Deluxe room and was given a free upgrade to a Junior Suite.  There was a fridge delivered to the guest upon their request.  We do have 2 outdoor Jacuzzis one of which was under repairs and the guest could have used the other one with no problem.   We do offer complimentary continental breakfast for all our guests from 7:00 AM - 10 AM on a daily basis.  We do offer valet parking for a fee and is not free.  There are other choices for parking in the area which was explained to the guest. There is also a bike rental shop that rents all types of bicycles and offers a discount to hotel guests but not complimentary. And it is unfortunate that some guests think they should get all services for free and threaten to write a negative review if their demands are not met.

Summary: Had 3 days planned in a suite, ocean view-216. Left after one night. Window cranks broken, could not close some windows, no screens on windows, 3 light bulbs out, TV advertised as time Warner, it did not have digital cable box so limited tv- night manager was surprised he thought all rooms fully equipped. We missed NBA playoff game. Electric plug in bathroom did not function. Has a pedestal sink in bathroom, had to put my wife's stuff on floor to use bathroom except light was so weak we had to use sink in living area. Had to ask for hair drier. Arrived at 12:30 promised room at 2pm, then 2:30 but did not get in till 3pm, staffs attitude was disappointing at best.    We forgot and left two purses behind when we checkout. We called the night manager that night and asked if they

Summary Heading: On the Beach in Newport, fall out of bed, into the ocean
Summary: What a great location, totally up to date property.   Beautiful finishes in the room.  The Balconies facing the ocean are a dream come true: having a cup of coffee or reading a book between activities.  The only alternative is to rent a house on the ocean for a week.  Comments about noise from the street from beach partiers was unfounded.  During Spring Break.    The hot-tubs were cool, especially with an ocean view.  The cute shops and restaurants in and around the hotel were nice too.  Parked in the City Lot next to the hotel, along the beach for free.  During the day we were mostly on the road or paid the $1.50 an hour to park in the public lot (saving $35 a day for valet).  Wifi was $20 a day, but our room faced Cabo and we jumped on their Wifi in the day/evening. Free.  The

There are really 2 different hotels, the Balboa Resort which is what they show you on the website and the  Balboa Inn which is under renovation. The Balboa Inn has old rooms with bathtubs from the 70's, poor lighting, no clock etc... I changed to a different room on my 2nd night for what I thought was $30.00 dollars more a night like it said on the website but was charged $60.00 dollars a night more. When I inquired about it the staff was rude and didn't want to help. They were supposed to talk to the manager and get back to me but never did. This was a dump in my opinion, BAD ROOMS, BAD SERVICE and a BAD EXPERIENCE.

Great location that you pay for.Room was a little small with not much of a view but it was okay.Food at the restaurant was good , and the patio where the complimentary breakfast was served was very nice.

We probably had the best room, upstairs corner, facing the ocean. Spacious with a coffee area, desk and a loveseat and coffee table. Sounded like there was water running next door all night...couldn't figure out what that was. The metered parking close by was free until 8am - we were planning to be at the dock by then so it worked out for us. The paid parking at the beach was pricey at $15/day. For being such a beautifully set up outdoor dining patio, the breakfast wasn't worth the stop. I've been to cheaper hotels that offered a better array. The bed and room were very comfortable and clean. No tea in the room only coffee. But tea was available at the breakfast.

I booked this hotel for my companies annual sales meeting for 10 employees for 4 nights. I could not have made a better choice. Michel and his staff were very accommodating and made us feel at home. We used the meeting rooms and they took care of the catering and our needs for the meetings each day. For price and location we were very impressed. Very easy to walk to many shops and restaurants in the very quaint boardwalk area. One night we walked 3 minutes to a ferry and crossed over to Balboa Island and experienced more very nice shops and restaurants. Can not get any closer stay to the sand and pier.  Breakfast was free and above average than most hotels with free breakfast. Only some parts of the hotel were under renovations however this did not get in the way of a great

Summary Heading: Pay attention, is your room at the the "Balboa inn" or the "Balboa Inn Resort"?
Summary: The professional photos show rooms from the "resort" section of the inn. The inn section is something completely different and under renovation. We were originally given a room in the "inn" section. OMG - parts of the hallway consisted of broken wooden flooring. The door to our room didn't close properly. The room was filled with newer furniture, but the room itself was like something from "frat house". Very old stained carpet, dirty chipped paint. tiny counter top dorm style mini fridge just sitting on the carpet. The bathroom was dark, dingy, with chipped paint and antiquated fixtures. There was no way we were going to stay there for the price! Luckily, when we told the reception that the room was not what we expected from the website, they moved us across the board walk to

The location of this hotel is almost perfect. Very near to local hot spots, easy access to the highways, beautiful spot next to the water. The inside of the hotel is nice and the location makes for good people watching at the bar/restaurant. However, the rooms are not that impressive... they need some major updating, especially for the price.

We stayed at Balboa Inn for one night between Sunday and Monday. Great value for what we think must have been the best room. A corner room on the top floor overlooking the beach.  Probably the best room we have had for a long time.   I can agree with other reviewers that it is noisy if there are people on the street being loud. Great staff. We will be back. What we saw on the web site was the picture to the left. What we experienced was the picture to the right.

Centrally located in Balboa and recently refurbished.  This is an older character property but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. Traveling in off season earned us a rate that was more palatable the in high season.

This hotel and Lisa; the event planner, was extravagant, the hotel and Lisa were the best, we had the best wedding, nothing went wrong, all went smoothly.  Lisa was more than helpful and the event went off without a hitch.  She was the best and the venue was perfect.  Everyone went out of their way to make sure we had the best time.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants a beautiful beach wedding. Absolutely Perfect.....Perfection...thank you Lisa...better late then never with this review.  Lisa you were the best!!!!!!Denise, mother of the bride

Stayed here for the last leg (3 nites) of our 10 day Cali vacation.  The location was great, but the cost was pretty high for the accomodations that we had.  Bathroom was small, hallway floors always seemed to be dirty, the fridge looked like something that came out of an old dorm room and the carpet on the small patio needed to be replaced very badly. Need a few carpets on the wood floors in the room, they always felt gritty.  Not the cleanest place we've stayed.  Front desk staff was always helpful. We felt crippled with not having access to our car when we wanted to go get it and had to have the bell person always go back and get it from Valet, which meant the need for tipping.  We did not know that parking was going to be $25 extra per day, probably didn't do our homework

Summary Heading: Great Potential - Needs Anthony Melchiorri (Hotel Impossible) to turn it around
Summary: What a wonderful location and property.  Desperately needs Anthony Melchiorri from the TV show Hotel Impossible to work his magic on this property.  Thoroughly disappointed in my stay.  The Web site is amazing.  The hotel room I was given at first was atrocious. Filthy carpets, dirty bathroom.  I almost called my corporate travel department to find me a different hotel.  Instead I called the front desk, and shared my disappointment the dirty room.  They offered me a different room, this one clean, but still nothing like the pictures on their own web site.  With such a nice web site, they are raising their guests expectations far too high with their standard rooms.  Love the location, but not this property.  I will not be back.

We chose this hotel because we were in town for a wedding, and the happy couple were staying there, too. When we emailed the hotel about a wedding rate based on the couple's names, we never received a reply. That should have been the only warning required. We initially booked at the Bay Club, but found a slightly (and I mean SLIGHTLY) lower rate at the Balboa a week prior to our stay. We cancelled the Bay Club and reserved a "deluxe king room" at the Balboa.  The staff was incredibly nice and helpful. They were very friendly and we have not a negative word to stay about the staff.  That being said...the website for the hotel (which I always check before booking through a third party) stated there was underground parking for guests. We could find no parking allotted to the hotel

Summary Heading: Great location right next to the pier
Summary: Great location-close to all the night life and the pier. Our room was clean and the balcony had comfortable chairs to sit and have drinks. The spa was clean. The continental breakfast was good and served in an area that was perfect if you wanted to hang out and talk.

I stayed August 19th  2013 in room 204.  For two hundred dollars my window backed into a brick wall.  I heard the clanging of pots and pans below and the guy in the bicycle shop  has a potty mouth. The structure is old, not much counter space in the bathroom.   I could not get my window to open but thank goodness the room had a fan overhead that gave some relief from the heat.  My son's room had a fan but it didn't give off much relief.....that was their air conditioning.  I loved the Casablanca feel to the room and loved the old carpet.  The hallway carpet is heavily stained but the tile patio floor is beautiful downstairs.  You will get charged 15.00 extra dollars to park your car across the street at the beach.  We had a few phone requests and someone was at our door to help

Summary Heading: Dirty standard rooms in un-renovated building
Summary: Our room was so disgusting and the manager/owner? was so unhelpful that we left the hotel without staying the night.  Anyone reserving a standard room (which runs $249/night in the summer) should beware. Our standard room was located in the un-renovated half of this hotel. The hallway carpet is dirty and hallway doors are propped open with filthy hand towels. Our room had mysterious red marks on the floorboards, questionable smudges in the bathroom and very worn furniture (see photos). Upon discovering a stain on the bed cover and requesting a new one, someone simply dropped a new one onto the corner of our bed. Stained cover still on the bed.  The manager (owner?) was surly and unhelpful. His solution was to offer us a suite in the renovated building for $400 - yes, we would be

We got the bait and switch too. Called ahead and were told they would hold a double 20 minutes. Got there in 10 and 'poof', only room now available was the suite. Regardless, REALLY old, cramped and smelling strongly of industrial disinfectant. The furniture reminded me of the bedroom set my sister and I had growing up in the 70's.  SO loud even with the windows closed.  Dumpsters, drunks and dudes don't care people are trying to relax and sleep.  On the plus side, very convenient to everything, cool looking from the outside. Lots of bronze sculpture tucked all over, staff very friendly and pleasant. Food and service at terrace restaurant very good although view of the beach is obstructed by railing. Bed was comfy, nice pillows.

Stayed in a family sweet with my husband and two kids in June...it was perfect.  Fantastic location, beautiful room (clean, updated and very comfortable) and fantastic staff!  Footsteps from the beach. Tons of shops, restaurants and activities in walking distance.  We will be back!

So to get those fancy rooms everyone has pictures of is an extra 300-400 a night on top on the 1100 a night in this dump I'm in now. Got a two bed room it has 2 BOX TVs, windows that open with a rotating handle and 2 of the 4 handles don't work so anyone can open or close my window thankfully I'm on the second floor. My room is 204 and outside my room happens to be the trash dumpster below me I can hear everything being dumped in there due to my windows not operating properly. NATS!!! I had to kill 5NATS flying around my bathroom from god knows what. 45$ for valet on weekends 35$ a day during weekdays not to mention the 10$ a day wifi fee. Looks like a broken smoke alarm in my room also, and then there is this god damn water pipe sticking out the wall I just stubbed my toe on.

Summary Heading: I tried them again with great outcome!
Summary: I reviewed this hotel last month when I was visiting Newport Beach. My experience was not an A+ rating on that visit. However I came back to Newport Beach and was sort of coerced to try balboa Inn again...and I did! Great Experience! The service was A+... My room was A+! I just wanted to give a shout out and thank the manager for responding to my last review..and let them know ..their attention to the details of customer service..was much appreciated on my second visit! as a matter of fact...I booked with them again for next week! So check them out and see what u think! I am going to try the Spa out while I am there this time..so I will let you know how that is soon!

Summary Heading: Bait and Switch! Total up sale!
Summary: We booked a Deluxe room which offered either a balcony, ocean view or fireplace. When we arrived, we were shown two different rooms on the 2nd floor of the "old" side of the hotel which has not been remodeled in at least 40 years! The hallway leading to the rooms looked and smelled like a dive motel in Vegas! I really thought we were being punked, the rooms where that bad! I would rather sleep in my car or a tent then in one of these rooms! I took a quick look in the bathroom and couldn't believe my eyes. I was in shock! Disgusting! It was clear that we had no intention of taking either room, so a third option was shown to us on the "newer" side of the hotel, at a higher rate, of course. This room was much nicer, but not worth the higher rate (even though they "discounted" it

After reading reviews, we picked this hotel because we thought it couldn't be that bad since the pictures on their website are very nice.  What they don't show are the rooms that haven't been remodeled.  We had the family suite and instead of a queen bed we were given a full bed.  The room was very old and didn't have air conditioning.  We asked for another room and they said that they were full, and that we should've asked if they had air conditioning when we booked the room. Whenever we had questions about our room, the staff was short and would say that they didn't know about things we had brought up, like the full bed instead of the queen bed.   We had to leave our windows open because it was so hot, and our room was facing an alley that echoed the bar next door.  Lets just

We stayed at the Balboa Inn for a few days the rooms are small but, the service is very good.  Be sure to dine on the terrace good food and great service. Also there's no pool but the beach is close by The location is good we enjoyed our stay once we changed rooms. The first room was like a box. But the owner moved us and all was good.

Summary Heading: An Oasis by the sea @ Balboa Inn
Summary: My husband & I have stayed at the Balboa Inn now several times... we love it there !!!  The rooms are beautiful !!!  We have stayed in the quaint & charming smaller rooms, and this last visit we stayed in one of the suites, spacious & gorgeous :-)   Both rooms were lovely, clean, inviting, relaxing... next time we will try to get one of the ocean front suites !!! The staff is amazing... from the time we checked in with, Laura, to the restaurant & bar with, Heather... The GM, Raymond went out of his way @ every availability to make sure our stay was first class, relaxing, everything we expected!   Raymond even helped us get a reservation for a young military couple who had their wedding there, but could not afford to stay there.    The location is ideal.. right in the heart of

Old rooms (floors 1 and 2) :   dark and gloomy, but with character  terrible/dark lighting in the rooms so no where to get ready or do makeup plus no good mirrors in rooms  terrible acoustics - so LOUD all the time + poor layout meant people were dinning/partying right outside your window  New rooms (floor 3) :   bright and clean, but depressing  saw 'new' rooms and the hallways and rooms are so cold and lifeless. Felt like staying in a hospital. Plus they put tile in the hallways...what?! In a hotel there are suitcases rolling down the hall all the time.  Having said that, the staff were very nice.

If you're thinking of staying in Newport Beach at the Balboa Inn, don't waste your time. The hotel is lost between capital improvements, over-charging and lack of service. The wifi works if you leave your room and go to the Siena restaurant in the hotel. You have to wait till noon every Wednesday for them to be open. The rooms that have been renovated are nice but over-priced. The rooms that haven't been proved are dirty, small and represent the "Flea bag flop house" where you would go to die! There are no real services. No room service, no spa and really nothing than location to offer. The hotel is located on the balboa boardwalk at the entrance to the Balboa pier. It is also very noisy and overpriced compared to other hotels in the area. I asked for a late checkout and was

We booked this hotel on a whim based on the location across the street from the Beach.  The photos looked very cute of the hotel.  When we arrived in our room- a family room- with 2 beds separated by a wall, we were very disappointed.  The room was very outdated, the TV looked to be from the 1970s and it was sitting on top of an old beat up table with a portable refrigerator.  The room was so small you could barely put our suitcases for a family of 4 on the floor and have room to walk.  Apparently this is the old section of the hotel.  Every time we walked up the stairs to our room someone was smoking on the roof, therefore forcing my 2 young children to walk through it.  You could hear all the commotion from the hotel restaurant from our room.  We still paid $300 per night for

Summary Heading: The remodeled rooms are fine but don't get stuck in the older section!
Summary: We wound up in Newport Beach because of a relative's untimely death. We stayed at the Balboa Inn because my sister-in-law got a great rate. Her room turned out to be incredibly shabby. Our ocean view "suite" was fine but not much of a suite. The continental breakfast was cereal, muffins, bagels and fruit. There was coffee and orange juice, but no water. Plus, the bar and restaurant are closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Overall, the place is way overpriced. But the staff was friendly, kind, and accommodating.

Summary Heading: Only steps away from the beach!
Summary: We stayed here for my niece's wedding and were so pleased with the amazing location- practically right on the sand.  The sunrise and sunset views were stunning!  The staff was very friendly, helpful and welcoming, and everything we needed for fun, dining and adventure was in walking distance from our room.  Great getaway location for travelers coming from out of the country, state, city, or even locals looking for a fun weekend escape from the ordinary.

My family & I have been coming to this very charming hotel for over ten years.  After renting local beach houses we decided to give it a try & never ever regretted our decision.  We love Laura at the front desk, of course Michele the owner all of the staff, and especially Mario.  After 35 1/2 years of marriage with vacations in Germany, locally in San Francisco, Santa Barbara, the Wrigley Mansion on Catalina Island, Furnace Creek in Death Valley, up & down the coast the Balboa Inn is always a must, something we look forward to & never, ever a disappointment.  Can't wait till July of this year to once again return to this unique local gem of a hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel for many years and have loved the experience every time. The location is unbeatable, the proximity to the beach, pier, fun zone, restaurants and bars is unmatched in the area. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the rooms are clean with an amazing oatmeal bar soap that my husband and I love. Opening the windows you get an amazingly crisp ocean breeze and you are literally just steps from the beach. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, as it truly is a great hotel and in the heart of Balboa.

I was hesitant to make a reservation based on other review but after talking with the lovely woman at the desk I decided to do it.  We were given an amazing rate for the room since it's off season - on the newer resort side. Great balcony, great view.  You should know that there is a parking lot between you and the hotel but the pier is beautiful.  I would def. stay again but on a weeknight.  The bar across the way was very loud and I just wanted to open the door and listen to the waves. (worst part) In the early morning when it was quiet the door was open and it was lovely. (fantastic) The staff was more than helpful and the location really is awesome.

Summary Heading: Funky, but charming and the only hotel on the beach in Balboa.
Summary: I am from the area and have stayed here many times for various reasons. Most recently We stayed here for my 40th birthday because of the hotels proximity to the Catalina Flyer. (It's across the street) This hotel has had many lives, most notably when Magic Johnson owned it in the 80's it was a crazy party hotel and it still kind of is. They have recently built a new building with new rooms which are new and clean but small. All the standard rooms in the new building only have one bed. Let me break it down for you. If you stay in a regular room in the old building be prepared for the 1 & 2 star reviews to come true. These rooms are old, funky, musty and a bit dilapidated. You must stay in a courtyard suite or an ocean view suite such as room 216, 221 or 220 which is the room we

I've stayed at this hotel three times.  Many years ago I stayed in the older rooms and to my recollection they were decent.  Definitely old and in need of some upgrading but they had a certain charm to them.  I cannot speak to the condition of those rooms today.  Recently, I stayed in a suite in the new tower.  The room was everything I expected.  New, modern furnishings and fixtures.  We had an ocean view and a balcony to sit outside on which was great.  The only negative thing I have to say about our room was the refrigerator didn't work and the TV channels were challenging to navigate (and no movie channels).  We didn't eat at the restaurant so I can't comment on that.  However we did have the continental breakfast and it was alright.  I would have liked to see more options

I so wish Yelp had negative category ratings for this one.  Let me preface my review by saying, I hope you have health insurance before you decide to book this place as a venue for any type of event, stay in the hotel, or even lower your restaurant standards to attempt eating here. My brother and his new wife had chosen to use the Balboa in as their wedding venue in November.  I went to see the venue the day before with my family, just to do a final review, prior to the big day. We had requested to have (1) table set with plates, glasses and flatware, as it would be set for the dinner reception.  When we walked in I noticed a table set with what I hoped wouldnâ€™t be a dinner setting for the next night.  (1) fork, (1) knife, a plate, and a water glass.  When I asked the wedding

We had to change rooms twice.  The first room had a piece of sheet rock cut out by the toilet and right on the floor exposing the plumbing.  The second room had a window that would not close overlooking the bar and the noise.  The crank to the window came out.  Had to call the desk again for help.  Their maintenance helper had to get on top of a sill on the second floor to close it.  The king size bed was lumpy.  We found out later that their was a $3.50 energy charge for heating as well as $3 charge for water.  A $35 charge for valet parking.  Nickel and dime on and on.  By the time I left our one night stand the bill came to $200.  We went down for a funeral memorial at Newport Landing so we could be within walking distance instead we found our stay a nightmare.  Reminded me

We were so excited to have found something fun to do on New Year's Eve so we booked 2 rooms at the Balboa Inn as part of a package for tickets to a Gourmet Detective mystery dinner at the hotel.  The mystery dinner was great and we all had a very good time.  Unfortunately, the hotel was so horrible we cancelled and went to the Newport Marriott instead.  They booked us into what was called the "Historical" section, however, this seems to mean very old and in poor condition. Fortunately our friends arrived before us and as we were checking in they came to the lobby to check out immediately after seeing their room.  Their room had very flimsy window coverings, cigarette burns on the dresser and the room was not in good shape.  Our room smelled musty and like like disinfectant, we

Well, I did the big "no, no" and booked a room without reading the reviews on tripadvisor. This place was bad. I guess I should have figured it out when the price was only $135, but I thought it was because it was the off season. On the outside  and their website, this place looks perfect.  The inside was a whole different thing. Our room looked more like a nice Motel 6. Very dingy and out dated. There were also toilets in the hall way! REALLY???

Summary Heading: Room #333 is awesome, customer service is lacking broken tub mgr is rude!
Summary: My girl and I have gone to this hotel several times for the restaurant Sienna's. Best Italian linguini I have had. This time we decided to stay at the hotel. We chose there most expensive room because it had a whirlpool tub in it. 340 dollars for the night. The room was really nice, clean and modern. The view with private balcony faced the pier and water. We checked in at 5pm Saturday night and were not allowed in the bar by this rude person who stated that a wedding was happening till 7pm. Also the valet parking charged us 45 dollars for parking because my truck was big. (F350). Went to another place for cocktails returned at 7 to bar came in thru another door bartender stated that we could of came in earlier and were given the wrong info. Anyways we had dinner and drinks,

Old world charm apparently means forget modern conveniences, like a/c.  Fortunately, after much persistence, the room was upgraded to a suite which did provide a/c, but only because our visit was during the off-season and the hotel was fairly unoccupied.  I would suggest the Hilton Waterfront in Huntington Beach, which is only fifteen minutes down Pacific Coast Highway. It is only slightly more expensive but 100 times nicer!

I stayed at the Balboa Inn in Newport Beach, California recently. The photos and the 'testimonials' painted a wonderful picture but that was not our experience. We had to deal with a wedding and rececption in the patio area adjacent to our room, then dinner service till after 11:00 in the same location with the wait station/busboy area directly in front of our open windows. It is a historic hotel, so there is no a/c as to be expected, so our windows had to be open exposing us to noise, clanging dishes, and second hand smoke from the patio below. Additionally, there were security lights that shined through the windows all night. There were no inside window coverings except for louvered blinds that had to be open to cool of the room. Oh, and the room was in need of updating

Way too expensive.  They should charge motel price, not resort price. Our "suite" was just a small room with a queen-size bed. Ocean view is more like parking lot view. Dirty reception area. Noisy machinery.  Noisy guests at night. Crappy-motel-worthy breakfast buffet with no meat or eggs. Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere else.

Summary Heading: Amazed at how bad it was.
Summary: The hotel from the outside was beautiful the inside was a different story. We arrived to find out that our room didn't have air conditoning. We had to sleep with the windows open and the fan on. They also provided us with a floor fan that I had to put in a chair so it would blow cool air on us. Our fridge was broken it was a terrible time. We paid $170 a night and they told us we could upgrade to a room (I assume maybe it would have air conditioning) for an extra $125 a night. The hotel was built in the 20's so some of the rooms have air conditioning others do not. The only pros to staying here was that the staff was very friendly and its very close to the beach.

We booked 2 nights at this hotel to attend a wedding.  While I typically book hotels through websites, I decided to call the hotel directly to book the room.  We were specifically looking for a location close to the wedding venue and this hotel proved to be the closest, however, I would have much rather stayed 20 minutes away than stay at this place.   I called the hotel directly to make the reservation because I saw they had family suites and I thought it would be nice if my mom, boyfriend and I could share a space as were would be traveling to the same venue together.  I was told there would be 2 bedrooms and a sitting room,.  There was a room with a queen bed, a hallway with a closet which led to the kind bed and bathroom.  There was no privacy, no separation of the rooms. It

I first saw the Balboa inn in 1965 I was 11 years old and it impressed me, sleepy old hotel on the beach, open air courtyard, beautiful architecture. My other half and I could not get our time share at Capistrano beach at Dana point so I said let's go to Balboa inn and watch the people. And what a great place to do that and not be at Venice beach or Santa Monica where the crime is. Our stay in 7/2011 was great, yes the beach is busy and there is a parking lot across from the hotel fun to look at the cars and people come to the beach and play. Music at the bar and everyone having a great time on the walkway. It is that time of year and it was busy and that is what we came to see. No trains, coast highway traffic, no walkway over the highway like Capistrano and we love Capistrano

Summary Heading: Beware! It's as bad as you read
Summary: My husband booked our holiday weekend here at the Balboa Inn without reading any reviews.  We had seen this hotel on our last trip to Balboa island and it looked cute. He wanted to take our son and girlfriend to the beach for the weekend and thought this would be a fun place to go. I started reading the horrible reviews about two weeks prior to our arrival. I had great reservation about staying here, so we called and spoke to a manager that assured us we could have a look at the room before we checked in, if it wasn't to our liking we did not have to pay. He also said it was the biggest suite in the hotel and very nice. We took a chance (first mistake) and kept the reservation. We arrived, and yes, the staff was friendly. We were shown the room, #216. It seemed clean, and since

I wanted to like this place.  It shows well online.  But, the rooms were filthy, small, and expensive.  Ancient windows fail to close properly eliminating the ability to drown out the incessant club noise from across the street.  We actually changed rooms after the first night, and they were very accommodating on that front.  Without air-conditioning, the temperature increases significantly with each higher floor.  It's lmost unbearable.  The portable industrial fan in the room was rusted and fuzzy with dust, but luckily loud enough to create a white noise buffer.  Bring foam ear-plugs if you stay here.  The rooms on the older side of the hotel are just run down and lazily maintained. Positives:  The water pressure in the shower was AWESOME.  The people were friendly and

The hotel has a great location.  Very close to the beach.  Other hotels are close to the beach too.  Location.  That's the good point.  Room was dirty, hot, no amenities that one might expect.  The fan on ceiling was wobbling so bad, it was odd watching it.  The towel hook was falling off the wall.  The noise was relentless.  Apparently, a lot of weddings go on there.  On our very long, or so it seemed, three day stay the various entrances (including the one with the elevator) was blocked by a party.  A bouncer type guy said we needed to take some other stairway.  Valet parking ..... $25.00 per night and $35.00 on the weekend.  We missed a dinner reservation waiting for our car.  Other times you just wait.  On the bright side, I would point out that right inside the lobby is a

The good news is this hotel is in a great location just steps from the sand. You are difinately paying for the location. The room was basic but clean The bed was comfortable. There is shopping and dinning within walking distance. I love the  "nastalgic beach of days gone by feeling" it was charming and warm. I would diffinately stay at the Inn again.  You wont be disappointed if you can afford the stay. The bad news is  the cont. breakfast did not look so good  I think the hotel should invest in a few changes in services as well they should have free parking at these rates for ther guest Paying 38.00 for parking is ridicuous. overall I did enjoy my stay

Summary Heading: Do not stay here- motel 6 quality at 5 star resort prices
Summary: We had booked this room for 4 nights and looked forward to our stay. I was expecting great accommodations considering I was spending $400 per night for a suite room.  We arrived on a Saturday and unloading / checking in was a nightmare. The area was incredibly crowded and there was no public parking. The front desk said we could valet our car for $45/ day on the weekend and $35/ day during the week day. Wow! Really? Ontop of $400/ night? No thank you. The rooms are old with old furnishings but my main complaint is the very loud noise from the bars and the constant traffic outside. After a very restless sleep due to the noise outside, traffic and just feeling sick that I am paying so much for a terrible hotel, we woke up to go to outside and had to jump over a pile of vomit at

Booked a suprise get away weekend for my husband and I.  Arrived at our room in the older part of the Inn.  What a disappointment for the price.  Reminded us of the place we stayed in Ecuador minus the bars on the windows and gun turret in the front.  Very run down.  Carpet sticky, bathroom ancient, torn curtain.  Our room was on the second floor above the street.  Paper thin walls could hear everyone's conversations at street level.  Finally got a little quieter around 3 am.  Neighbors across hall were also arguing and yelling most of the night and slamming their door.  I went down the next morning and told them we were checking out.  They said they would try to put us in another room after noon which was check out time.  Had planned a nice day at Balboa Island but both of us

Took a mini vacation with my husband and stayed at the Balboa Inn. All I can say with the agreement of my husband is that you definitely pay for the location and not much more. We did stay on the more costly "resort" side and the view of the ocean was beautiful. The room however was not impressive. It was very small for the price. Modern appearance done with inexpensive tricks. The windowsills and window screens were extremely dusty. Loveseat had white crusty stains (eeew). Bath tub was huge spa style but the jet streams were obnoxiously loud we had to yell at each other to have a conversation in the tub. wifi was not free, 10 dollars a day for only ONE device! Valet was $25 a day. Little did I know the adjacent beach parking was only $15 for a 24 hour period. I should have

My husband and I decided to take a mini vacation a few weeks ago, and eventually we wound up at the Balboa Pier located on the Balboa Penninsula.  After parking our car, we started walking around and discovered how much there was to do!  So we rented bikes on Main Street next to the Balboa Inn, went shopping, found some great restaurants, went to the Fun Zone and took the ferry over to Balboa Island.  A great time!   It was getting late, so we decided to check out the Balboa Inn for a stay over.  We looked at a few rooms, checked out their rates and finally decided on their mini suite located in the historic part of the inn.  It had a fireplace with sofa, chair and refrigerator;  a romantic cozy bed area, and best of all, the jacuzzi shower!  It felt like being under a

The exterior of Balboa Inn and location is beautiful.  However, for the price we paid for one night's stay (approx. 250), we expected more for our room.  We understand that the building is old, but that did not explain why there was tape on some parts of the carpet in the hallways, unattractive and small rooms and the valet parking was very expensive.  The most courteous person at Balboa Inn was the valet attendant, but to retrieve our vehicle each time would cost $35 plus tip!  Beware...not worth staying here.  We should have done our homework prior to booking this hotel!!

Summary Heading: Lacked my 2 most important features..quiet and cold
Summary: First off, the inn is very nice and quaint and right at the base of the pier. I really liked that the Cabo Cantina was right across the street. The two most important things to me though are quiet rooms and a cold AC I can adjust. The standard room I received did not look anything like the pics online. There was no restaurant or bar open in the hotel and it seemed like a ghost town at first. I did visit on a Tuesday night in April, so that may explain why the Inn seemed dead.  There was no adjustable air conditioner, only a way to kick on the heat. The room was noisy from patrons across the hall as well as outside noise. While the staff was very friendly and the place seemed nice and cozy, I wont return due to noise and lack of an AC.

Summary Heading: If I could give a negative score I would.
Summary: Terrible customer service. The room was the smallest low budget room I have ever stayed in. A motel six would have been nicer. The manager was rude and dishonest, tried to charge us more than our friends were paying for better rooms!!! Unreal....!!! I've never had such a bad experience at a hotel before. I would avoid this place like the plague...!!!

This was by far, the worst hotel that me and my girlfriend ever stayed in.  The room was over priced, old, broken down and noisy.  We had two very active neighbors that kept making noise all throughout the night until 2:30 AM.    The hot water from the restroom was broken.  The carpet was extremely dirty.  Bed is uncomfortable. Pillows are impossible to sleep on.  AC wasn't working.  No windows treatments except for twisty shades that were broken.   Bar was downstairs and very noisy, filled with drunken kids.  Room wasn't in the least bit sound proof, could hear all activity from your neighbors.   Doesn't look as if the room was cleaned or updated before we checked in. Toilet paper was half way used. Really uncomfortable to use the small bathroom.  Couldn't even take the hanger

Summary Heading: Take a deep breathe... this place is perfect
Summary: I use to live in this area so I knew the area well and knew right where I wanted to be. I had known the exterior of this hotel but never been in. I read the reviews on here when planning to visit friends and family in the area. I was SO nervous after reading the reviews for the old part as they call it on here, but the "historical part" as the hotel phrases it. We went ahead and booked anyway, knowing the are and that we would not be spending much time in the room anyway, and you would be crazy to take a trip here if you are a room sitter. However, when we arrived at the sand set hotel I couldnt be happier to be there. We saw the room and were so pleasently surprised after the reviews posted. This room was placed on the third floor that exited out to a joined patio with adorable

I travel frequently to the OC for work, so am familiar with the area and had passed by the Balboa Inn many times. The location is great â€“ right on the peninsula, steps away from the beach, the pier and the Fun Zone.   But location is pretty much the only saving grace of this hotel. On the outside, the hotel keeps up appearances decently well, and itâ€™s a nice structure along the beachwalk. Inside, the hotel is just plain dingy. From other reviews, it seems thereâ€™s a new side and an old side (or â€œHistoricalâ€). The old side is exactly that â€“ old, and rather unkempt.   I had booked a family room, which consisted of 2 sleeping areas â€“ a double bed immediately upon entering the room, and a larger space with a queen bed in the back near the bathroom. The carpet smelled like it hadnâ€™t

The staff is terrific, however they cannot compensate for a noisy, shabby and archaic hotel. Yes it is near the beach. Not good enough, for 180 bucks a night, I expect more than torn lampshades, backed up plumbing and a constant stream of NOISE! Our room was adjacent to the stairs and the upstairs patio dining, which was the place of a wedding. No warning, nothing. I called the front desk and complained about the noise at 2 m and they offered to move us, but really? Move or shut up the people who are so inconsiderate.    Best bet- pay less, stay further away and sleep well.

I'd stay again as now I know which room to book. This is actually two hotels, two buildings, one old, one new that's water front.  The old is run down and it wouldn't take much to spruce it up, but I guess they've spent their money on building the new part.  The old rooms are large, large bathrooms too, they have refrigerators and carpet.  Be careful of rooms facing the street because of the bar, or overlooking the restaurant in the rear, however the restaurant closes at 10PM. The beds are all new throughout the hotel (I saw 7 rooms), but I found them too soft--they are pillow top top and bottom, I turned mine, but they are just too thick, so you sink. I didn't really like the new part, it is ocean front, rooms very modern, cold tile floors, I thought I'd hear the ocean but

We are a family of two adults and two teens, booking a family room ( two rooms connected by a hallway) NIGHT: Do not be fooled by the pictures on the website, the family room was in the original part of the hotel which would have been fine if they took any pride! The rooms could have been "Quaint" instead of "Run Down" they painted over the wallpaper in the bathroom, the bathtub was cracked (at the top no leakage), one straight back chair, there was no air (fine... beach hotel) but the windows had no screens, the portable fan looked like a carry-over from the 50's ( nervous to use it but disparate for relief), the view was of a brick wall/alley with skate boarders & loud talkers and the room was above the restaurant kitchen,  It was loud, hot and miserable.... DAY: We moved on

We stayed for 2 nights.  Such a convenient location & a nice, bright airy room with a great big soaking tub & a cute little balcony with an ocean view.  But, we got almost no sleep!  There is a bar nearby that's open till early in the morning.  I don't think it quieted down till about 2:30 or 3.  Drunk people shouting & banging on things.

Searched for an hour to find parking for a wedding my husband and I were attending. There valet parking was full, beach parking, full... metered parking... full!!! I called the lady at the front desk 5 times!!! How can you have a wedding at your Hotel if you dont have parking for your guests??? Once we finally arrived to the wedding and had to stand in the back, the hotel allowed wet guest in their swim suits run back and forth the wedding aisle to get to their rooms!!! The bar had 1 bar tender for over 140 people, the staff was totally confused and had no direction. Beware!!! DO NOT use this place for your wedding!!!

Summary Heading: Hotel needs a total redo, rooms are soooo gross
Summary: The location in newport area is second to none, so if you don't plan on being in your room then you'll be fine,  but if you expect a clean room, things like air conditioning, lights and ceiling fans to work, a pool, and family size rooms then this ain't the place.  The hotel uses "luxury", "beautiful", "spacious" to market the hotel,  reality is a "suite" with one bed and a pull out couch, non-working ac, walls and doors so dirty you don't want to touch them and more amateur attempted electrical and tile repairs than you can count.  surroundings are spectacular for the location, hotel is weak at best.

My husband decided to surprise me for a nice getaway to Newport Beach and we stayed at this hotel. We absolutely LOVED it! The rooms were amazing and the view was breath taking! One thing that I really loved about the rooms is that they were super clean compared to most hotel rooms. If you stay here you definitely need to have a balcony view! They also offer free continental breakfast for those light eaters and everything you need is in walking distance.

Great location for an at the beach experience.  Staff was very friendly, helpful and welcoming.  Laura at the front desk could not have been nicer and more accomodating to make sure that our stay was the best.  Mario, the man who handles all the big and little jobs around the Inn was very helpful as were the valets for parking and help with our bags and showing us around the Inn at check in.  Great continental breakfast set up in a comfortable patio setting.  Great service and food at the on site Italian restaurant, Sienna.  Rooms are comfortable, but understand that there are watering holes in the area that make the late night partying noise something that you "might" wake you up around closing time.  Would stay there again for sure!

We stayed in Balboa in June and really enjoyed this hotels location and history. Some of the rooms, however, are very sparse and dated. We were first brought to a room like this and when we asked for another room, we were given a great room with a balcony. We did need earplugs at night because we were right across from a noisy bar, but it was worth it for our great view and comfy room.

I was there for a Daddy & Daughter (15yo) weekend.  The hotel has two sides that are a Dr. Jekyl & Mr. Hyde.  There is the "Resort" side where the suites are and is newly refurbished and nicely appointed.  If you have the dough, then book there.  The other side, where I stayed... well, let's just say that If you describe yourself as having discriminating tastes whilst others describe you as picky, if you don't have the money and would need to book these rates, then this hotel may not suit you.  If you're able to look the other way at some paint chipped walls, old fixtures, small rooms (by American standards, plenty large by European standards), then for location, location, location, this location can't be beat!  It is a 60 second walk to the Balboa Pier.  It is a 3 minute walk

Summary Heading: Dilapidated and filthy. Drunks and rowdy teens at all hours. Teeny tiny rooms, odd smells and fixtures falling off.
Summary: The bad: rooms are TINY.  Little to no floor space, dirty carpet, we had to wear shoes or our feet turned black.  Chipped tile in dirty shower, soap dish hanging from one screw, toilet seat fell off.  You can hear every noise in the hotel so don't expect to sleep, it's close to bars so around 2-3am all the drunks return to their rooms, banging, yelling, generally obnoxious.  No pool, they lost our car, stood in valet for over an hour. The woman whose car they brought before ours was covered in bird feces.    The good: excellent location right at the end of the pier and near boardwalk.   An amateur operation at best, we will never stay here again.

We stayed there for 3 nights during June 2011. If we could have gotten out of the 2nd and 3rd night we would have but we were told you had to cancel a week ahead of time. Our initial room was very poor in size, location, and upkeep. My husband asked for a change in rooms and we were moved to a room that had a sofa bed and jacuzzi tub on the second floor. Location was much better as was the size but the upkeep was less than desirable. A little paint and some new carpet could go along way. The "deluxe continental breakfast" was quite minimal consisting of cereal, bagels, and fruit....the same thing everyday.  The orange juice was quite good though ;-)  On a more positive note the staff was very kind and the location is great. Across the street are some shops and restaurants as

We recently stayed at this hotel quite by chance.  It was late & we were looking for somewhere in the Balboa area of Newport Beach.  We stumbled upon the Balboa Inn, which is located, fantastically, on the main street which links Balboa Pier & the ferry that links this part of Newport to the main Newport.  With the front rooms overlooking the beach this property is ideal of a couple that may be looking for a romantic getaway as well as what we were looking for which was a good quality hotel in a good location with plenty of restaurants & small, local bars to choose from.  Newport is a special place & with its complementary breakfast outdoors, pool & convenient parking the Balboa Inn is a special hotel.  Right from my phone call with the hostess on reception to the greeting we

I used to live in the area and like to come back every so often. I love to stay at the Balboa Inn. The staff is so friendly, they have a continental breakfast in the morning and the location is awsome. I usually go to stay one night but I end up staying 2 because I just don't ever want to leave. I strongly recommend staying there when you're in the Newport Beach area.  John Erick

i recently had my honeymoon and stayed at the Balboa Inn, in Orange county california, and i must say i was a little cautious having read some of the bad reviews on here. However i was pleasently surprised. Not only is the location perfect, the beach being literally steps away, but the service was great and the room we had was stunning with immaculate pacific views. The hotel itself was gorgeous, more like a boutique hotel than an overpriced modern hotel, and the charm shone through with the politeness and helpfullness of the staff. I would certainly recommend the Balboa inn to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the newport beach area.

Summary Heading: This is the worst hotel with the worst service I have ever seen.
Summary: This is the worst hotel with the worst service I have ever seen. The staff is rude, fraudulent and extremely unprofessional. Every detail of the stay and service was horrible. I do not recommend this hotel.

Here are the facts: We arrived really late & immediately went to sleep, so we didn't notice the prior guest's underwear hanging in the shower until the next morning. We also noticed that the lampshades were torn and stained, the toilet belched and bellowed when other guests flushed and showered, the walls were stained and had gashes dug into them, and tiles were severely cracked in the bathroom. Upon waking, I smelled aftershave/cologne on the pillow. Neither I nor my spouse wears the stuff. The next day I found bug bites on my arms, face, and neck. The "continental breakfast" consisted of single-serving boxes of Fruit Loops and other similar cereals, oranges or apples, and convenience store pastries wrapped in plastic. Summary Heading: Worst hotel experience of my life
Summary: I found this hotel through yahoo travel. It looked cute in the photos but when we got there the rooms were old and dirty and didn't have air conditioning. No where on the website does it let you know about the air.  It was so hot the day I booked the room that I couldn't stay there. I checked out after only 5 minutes but they refused to give me a refund. This hotel is horrible! Do not stay here.

Summary Heading: A Great Way to Spend Thanksgiving!
Summary: Just wanted to take a moment to write a review about this terrrifc hotel!  It's great for anyone!  We are Orange County residents and only live 15 minutes away from Newport, but we wanted to stay on the beach near our favorite beach!  We couldn't have chosen a better hotel!  The staff was super friendly and made us feel VERY welcome!  Our rooms were clean and roomy for our family of 6!  We all had a blast walking around town, sampling all the great food both at the hotel and  at adjacent restaurants!  We plan on going back again soon!  It's nice to have a hotel close to home that offers such great hospitality in such an amazing location!  Even if I didn't live close by, I'd recommend traveling to Balboa Inn from anywhere.!  The beaches are fantastic and GREAT for kids (there's

Summary Heading: Sometimes it's NOT  just Location, Location, Location - STAY AWAY!
Summary: The only thing going for this palce is the beach setting.  Our room (#307) was dreary and outdated, overlooked Main St and a bar across the street. One night there was an "event" going on that spewed out into the street with profanities and fighting which brought the police, not from the hotel staff, but from the guests calls. The staff wanted nothing to do with it.  Plus the garbage pickup at 4am. I asked for a room change and was told they could move us to the resort side for an upgrade fee of $50, which is usually much higher, because of the "inconvienence". Their  "Complimentary Deluxe Continental Breakfast" was nothing more than cold cereal, coffee, apples/oranges and bagels. Very poor lighting in the bathroom, no iron or hair dryer (until asked for) or a full length
I stayed here with friends and we just booked as walk-in guests, the service was great, the rooms were lovely and clean and the decor was fantastic, highly recommend this place!

Summary Heading: The pictures of the room are a lie, another fee for everything!!!!
Summary: They show you your room before you check in so you will upgrade to a more expensive room. The people that were there our first night were all rude and not interested in are needs and concerns. My sister slipped in the hot tub andwe reported this to the front desk and the blonde clerke said what do you want me to do about it. Our concern were for the elderly people who were visitors at this dive! If my sister's arm was broke, would they had called a EMT? They don't have customere service at this motel!

I know this area well and was very confident that this was a good choice of hotel. I chose the Family Suite and looked over the pictures and explanations before I booked. What the pictures or description didn't show was a bed crammed into each room in the old side of the hotel with a horrible musty smell. Because it was slow they could upgrade for fifty extra dollars for the single which maybe ok but fifty dollars extra for a single when Im already paying over $300.00 for a suite. Not quite right. The newer rooms are beautiful but buyer beware when booking these rooms because you truly do not know which one your getting.

Summary Heading: OVER PRICED, SMALL ROOMS, VERY NOISY
Summary: We were on the peninsula for my husband's birthday and stayed 2 nights.  We were upgraded from a room in the historical building to one in the "resort".  We were told it was a $500 room we could have for $269.  It was small but very clean.  The bed was too soft for my husband but I loved it....it was like sleeping on a cloud.  The balcony was small and had a solid surround so if you wanted to enjoy a drink there, when you sat down, all you saw was a wall.  The hotel is not "on the beach" as advertised.  It is on the public beach parking lot.  People were coming and going at all hours....very noisy.  The free continental breakfast was probably okay but on the first morning, when we went to the terrace at 8:45, all the table cloths had been removed and the workers were putting

Summary Heading: The Balboa Inn is not a place for families, it is a DUMP intended for beach bums
Summary: We originally chose to stay at the Balboa Inn based on the photos on their website and that a family member had stayed there the year before without comment (which we got the day we checked out, a total dump).  It is advertised as a "historic hotel" but the photos show the rooms in the â€œresort wingâ€ only. We reserved a room classified as a FAM/Q/K which offers a either a king or queen bed in the bedroom and a double bed in the entry room.   The entry room was cramped with a double bed and two end tables that faced the bed, you could not even open the drawers.  We immediately expressed our dissatisfaction to the front desk and requested (if not demanded) a room change to what was advertised on their website, as we are a family of four and not a bunch of college frat brothers who

Summary Heading: Nasty, dirty and complete disaster for our family vacation!
Summary: The room they gave us was as far from a resort or spa as one could possibly imagine.  There were restaurant TRASH CANS outside the door to our room with a nasty roll away bed parked on the other side of the door.  The only window was about one foot square and located at the ceiling.  The floor was slanted and the dresser in the room was proped up with a block the the whole thing rocked when you opened or closed the door.  They did move us rooms for the first night but at more than double the cost of the first room and they had nothing for the second day of our trip, which left us stranded for Saturday trying to pack up and find a room.  NEVER AGAIN!

Summary Heading: Location is the ONLY thing going for this hotel
Summary: I agree with most of the other reviews. I guess I ended up staying in the "historical" side of the hotel as opposed to the "resort" side because no way the rooms look like what is on their website. Rooms were outdated, beds were hard, we had a 2 queen bed room and the layout of the room was very awkward. Typical for an old beach hotel - walls were thin, windows were old, A/C didn't work, furniture and bathrooms were old and outdated. Thank goodness my GFs and I only stayed 1 night because everyone couldn't get out of there fast enough. The good part for this hotel is the location. Everything on Balboa is within walking distance (bars, restaurants, beach, pier, bicycle rentals, etc.). Also nice was an outside patio attached to the old part of the hotel and the new. It had an

I concur with other reviewers that the rooms in the older wing of the hotel are in serious need of renovation.  The one my friend and I had was adequate, nothing more.  Bed comfortable, TV very poor, blinds did not close fully nor did drapes, no bathroom window or exhaust fan.  Expensive for what you get but the location can't be beat.  Hotel staff was friendly and generally helpful.  Internet access by daily fee...one of my pet peeves.  Recommend with reservations if you're not planning to spend a lot of time in your room.

Summary Heading: make sure you get a confirmation
Summary: Was quoted a price by one of the "sisters" and upon check out the other sister wanted to charge 3 time the quoted price. If fact they did not want to even give me the 3rd night free as advertised on the website. Ruined my stay.

We had two adjoining rooms in the newly renovated part of the hotel.  The rooms were on the second floor with balconies and fantastic views of the beach.  The rooms were very clean and newly updated.  The staff was excellent and extremely helpful - the best customer service I've experienced at a hotel in a long time.  The location was perfect.  The hotel is within two minutes walking distance of several restaurants, shops and bars.  Overall it was one of the most enjoyable places I've stayed in a while.  We had a great time and would definitely go back.  The only drawback - $18 per night to park your car.  Thanks to the staff for a wonderful stay!

We booked 2 weeks prior to travel.  I was assured that it would meet all the needs of a business traveller.  Upon arrival we were sent to a room that was the smallest we have ever seen.  Stains on the beds, most of the light bulbs were burnt out, and the bathroom floor was was so stained it was gross.  At $140 a night I expect a good room. We talked to the front desk, who was happy to change us to the next room up, for $500 per night.  We informed them we were leaving then, and did not want any charges.  The lobbies response was no problem, they get this a lot !!! Absolute dump.  For the same price ($140) we got a room on the water in Redondo Beach, 3 times the size, 4 star that night.

Summary Heading: Nice Location -disappointing room for the price
Summary: While this hotel has a lot of charm from the outside, the historic room was shabby and disappointing for as much money as we paid. There was outdated artwork on the walls with furniture half in front of it.  Lamps and shades were bent,  crooked and old, The ceiling fan blades were full of dust. In the bathroom, there was a sunken tub that had once been a jacuzzi tub. The controls were removed and the pipes left exposed....  There was newer paint on the walls in the bathroom but the sloppy job included  the door frame some of the floor tiles.... . The  bedroom windows would not shut entirely and the noise level was very high (even with earplugs) until the bar closed nearby.   In terms of the room, the bed was comfortable; that is the only positive.  Had  someone taken some time

First, I will start with our experience then give the two key points/expectations to know when staying here. We were looking for a nice New Year's getaway and really liked the location of the Balboa Inn. I checked out the website and ALMOST booked a room from expedia. At the last minute decided to call the Inn first because of the mixed reviews here on trip advisor and the lack of description of the room on expedia.  I called the inn and the gal was pleasant and walked me through the website photos of the rooms (3 types).  The pictures that pop up first on the website are of the modern 'resort' rooms. I had been ready to book in the old 'historical' rooms.  I asked if she could give me a better rate than expedia and she said yes. Since it was the 'slow' season, we got a resort

Very nice location, right on the beach.  The room was so small there was no room for a chair.  No air conditioning; the blinds were broken and would not close.  The bathroom had no window and no exhaust fan.  Probably a code violation.

My husband planned a ten year anniversary getaway at this hotel. The receptionist was told it would be a special night for the two of us. When we got there we were given a room above the kitchen. It was hot and there was no air conditioning. Worse, we realized there was a wedding beginning right outside our window. We thought okay, when the wedding is over then we can cool off by opening the windows and having some privacy. Nope, the wedding went on all night. We complained about the children running up and down the hall, ( wedding guests) . Our room might have well been in the middle of the reception. The hotel was noisy with wedding goers, especially on the patio area a few feet from my bed.  We asked about the noise the hotel manager assured us that it would end soon. So much

Summary Heading: From the land of Oz to paradise.
Summary: Granted folks from Kansas are not use to oceans of water. Our stay here was the perface experiance. We wanted to stay near the beach and we found the perfact place. We were able to walk (less than 100 yards) to the beach to experiance the most beautiful sunrise. The rooms were very comfortable and nastalgic,the beds were soft, and with the ocean breezes coming in the window everything was perfact. Folks that complain about the facilites and the neighbors need to go back to the hilton with thier noses in the air. If you want to relax at the beach this is the place for you.

Summary Heading: Just ask for the "not so old" rooms
Summary: We booked the $199 room. It is not the one shown on the website by any means. Really shabby. I don't mind old; I don't mind small; I don't even mind not-remodeled-in-a-long-time. But the furnishings just weren't nice. Moreover, it was very hot and seemed that it probably wouldn't cool down at night. The old rooms simply need a little facelift. HOWEVER, when I spoke with the manageress on duty, she agreed to upgrade us. If we hadn't been upgraded, I think I would have felt ripped off. It was the most expensive hotel in the area. Granted it's at the end of the pier, so it is going to cost more.  I'd definitely stay again. I loved the old-fashioned feel of the place, the breakfast out of doors with a view, and the kindly staff. All in all, a very nice stay.

We just came from this quaint hotel right at the end of the pier, we had a great time and loved the room, very clean and charming. Staff was very welcoming and helpful. We loved the atmosphere and the view was great!  We will be back for sure!! and recommend a suite. MP & JT Santa Clarita, CA

Summary Heading: If you want to get any sleep, do not stay here
Summary: This is the NOISIEST hotel I have ever stayed in.  The charming, open patio areas on the ground level and second floor are pleasant to sit in and chat during the day -- but people continue to sit and chat and yell and run up and down the stairs ALL NIGHT.  Just when you think you're going to drift off into an exhausted slumber (I'm talking 3:30 a.m.), someone else goes by yelling for his friend, or galloping up the stairs.  Granted, there was a high school reunion when I was there -- but still, you would think even they would go to bed sometime -- or that at least the hotel management would tell them to go into their rooms and be quiet.  Further, it is HOT.  No A/C, just fans, which means the windows have to be open, which prevents any escape from the constant noise.  Oh, and if

We made the mistake of believing what was shown on the website for how the rooms looked.  WRONG.  The rooms on the website are part of the "new" hotel of which there are a very very limited number.  The hotel rooms in the old part of the hotel are beat up. Cracked tiles, very noisy, and hot!  I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.  Very very poor.

The noise from the bar across the street was bad enough, but when night management does nothing (except make excuses) to keep other guests from partying and swearing right outside your window till 3:30 in the morning; that is inexcusable.  We had to call and complain 3+ times several of the nights we were there.  Our room/bath was in need of major updating and very overpriced for what you got.  We booked this hotel because my daughter planned her wedding/reception on sight and we thought it would be convenient. A good number of our wedding guestsâ€™ booked rooms also.  They were just as displeased about the noise a condition of rooms.  Although the wedding was lovely (wedding coordinator/staff helpful) I really expected a much classier place for the location and price of the room.

Summary Heading: The best of lodging, the worst of lodging
Summary: Great location at the foot of the pier.  Easy walk to the beach, or the interesting shops and restaurants in the Balboa area.    However.... It's perhaps the noisiest hotel we've ever stayed at.  You have to understand the architecture.  The brochure shows the new, airconditioned, sealed window wing of the hotel.  With a price to match.  The older, original building has no A/C.  But that's not a problem with the cool sea breeze right?  Nope.  With windows only on one side, there's no way to get airflow through the room.  The only cooling is with the windows wide open.  Don't try to nap Sunday afternoon.  Loud band in the bar below.  Don't try to sleep at night.  Loud patrons in the bar below, and from the bar across the street.  Don't try to sleep late in the morning.  Street

Summary Heading: If you like small rooms, noise and no air conditioning this if for you.
Summary: The delux rooms are sooo small and hot and lacking in every thing.  The hotel is OLD and has no upgrades.  The bar has over priced drinks, $8 beer.  The lack of air conditioning is top on my list of never going back to this hotel.  the hotel staff claim that if you book on expedia (or any on line booking other then theirs) you get the oldest part of the hotel and stuck over looking the alleys with the noise.

We booked a room in the Inn at an off-season price of $199 and then upgraded for another $100, making the rate $299.   The $299 room was gorgeous and had many amenities, but the air conditioner was on top of the roof above the room, causing constant noise.  The toilet was broken and ran all night.  The next day we changed to a cheaper and quieter room.  It, too, had a shower that did not work; a towel rack that was falling off the wall and continental breakfast that was laughable.    The location is noisy, near the bars, but close to the boardwalk which was convenient and pretty.  This is a very expensive hotel in the high season - over 600 per room and, definitely, not worth it.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and rather special - a lovely place to stay
Summary: Ideally situated, overlooking the beach, but right in the middle of everything.  Really delicious food.  Staff not as switched on as at a 5* hotel, but that's what gives it such a friendly atmosphere.

Summary Heading: Believe it or not, a comfortable bed...
Summary: I booked this hotel with a bit of caution.  We were headed to a wedding that was literally 2 blocks away, and didn't want to have to worry about driving home.  It has been years since I actually had a key (not a key card) to open the door to the room.  The staff was very friendly, and even offered an upgrade for us but we opted out.  This hotel is old.   But trust me, better than driving home after a wedding.   The bed was comfortable, and yes, we threw off the bedspread the moment we walked in the door (scary and yuck).  It had a two person tub which was awesome.    It was quiet and a bit warm, I wouldn't recommend staying here in the summer unless you had an airconditioned room.  All and all, good place to stay, but yes, know what you are getting in to.  There's a reason why

Horrible dated furniture, an old bulbous-screen tv that couldn't get CBS clearly (Masters weekend), scuzzy carpet, a dorm-style fridge (empty), no pool, and a wall-unit air conditioner. Summary: The noise was so bad here I couldn't believe it. The room smelled and they had the nerve to charge so much for an awful room. It states it's on the sand. It is NOT. Rip off for the dog fee too. Would never stay here again.

Summary Heading: hated it do not stay here!
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE!  You will be very angry at yourself.  It was SO NOISY I could not hear myself think.  There is no air conditioning and my children cried during the night.  There is a bar across the street that sings kareoke till the wee hours AT EXTREMELY LOUD RANGES.  The decor is dated, the plumbing drips, their are pigeons outside the windows, a train blows a whistle at 3am and the manager will not return a phone call.

Summary: I love love love the location and the way the Inn looks from the outside. After you cross the entry from the street it is all downhill. The rooms are small and not at all updated (Allthough the inn is advertised as being totally renovated on their postcards. The postcards also say there is a pool and spa, not the case). There were places in the bathroom where the wall had been badly patched, very ugly and motel 6 like. The walls are paper thin and we could hear each and every time someone on our floor entered or left their rooms. The street noise is awful. Don't plan to sleep. This hotel has serious issues.  It is noisy.  It smells bad.  The staff is rude.  Unfortunately I did not read the reviews before booking.  I will never, ever do that again.  For the price we paid I feel I should call the police and report a robbery.  I don't see how the health department doesn't shut them down.

My wife and I were supposed to stay in this hotel for two nights, as soon as I passed the facade and entered the hallway to the rooms I was extremely disappointed.  The only rooms that have air conditioning are the suites for $399/night.  There is an old ceiling fan and a stand-alone fan that was dirty and old.  With both fans on high all night the room was bearable, but for the rates that we were charged I was appalled.  The furniture was soiled with years of stains the origin of which no one knows.  The carpet was so dirty and stained that we didn't dare take off our shoes.  We cancelled our reservation for the second night and had to fight with management until we were able to cancel with out being charged.  I am told that is not usually the case.

My son and I spent a week at the Balboa in June and it was everything I could have hoped for - and more!  The hotel is just an easy stroll away from the beach and pier and just slightly farther from the Fun Zone where there is an arcade for the kids, boat trips around the harbor and access to Balboa Island.  There are many nice restaurants and shops, a pharmacy and grocery store all within walking distance.  And the hotel was absolutely marvelous.  The staff was very friendly and paid close attention to our every need.  The restaurant in the hotel had good food and the best people staffing it. I could not believe the total for one night with a purchase of water from the room was $389.00 dollars.  The lady in the front discounted room 220 for not having any air and they complained it was too loud.  They got discounted $49.00 dollars and was charged $200.00 instead of $249.00.  I was in room 219 and was charged $349.00 no discount.  For the money it was the absolute worst.  I guess I can be grateful thier were no fleas.

Our family of four stayed here in early April for our spring break trip.  I thought it would be nice to be on the beach and explore the area.  I was willing to spend more for the location and the pictures on the web site looked very inviting.  As soon as we arrived into our room I knew we had spent too much.  The walls were dirty, the beds were very uncomfortable, and the room was very small.  The web site listed a pool, but we were told that because of construction it was not available.  And at night we sat up and listened to the loud bar patrons, some who were fighting just below our window.  We decided to leave two days early because we were so disappointed and the pool wasn't available.  I've never paid this much for such a run down hotel, and I wish I had read the reviews

When we finally got our room which was supposed to be a suite at $365 a night, it was very small with no sitting area and no ocean view due to the new construction which blocks any view from the old area.
