My family and I enjoyed every moment of our vacation from the moment we stepped foot onto California soil. We loved our experience at tha Balboa Inn, from the friendly staff to the exceptional Italian restaurant located below the hotel. The beaches are so clean and literally right out your front door...Will we stay again  next year? Absolutely! We can't wait. Thanks again for the magical experience.

While this hotel did have great location, that was the only good thing about it.  The owner/manager needs a lesson in customer service.  We were there for 5 nights and every night there were people running down the halls cursing and screaming.  When someone complained about it, the response was "we will address it in the morning", which of course, never happened.  On our last night there, they decided to do construction in the room right next to us.  In addition to the noise, they turned off the water in our room at 9:00 pm without advanced notice.  This was just when I was trying to get my 2 and 3 year old ready for bed. We stayed at this hotel because the location was so great.  We were able to walk to the Fun Zone and the pier, there are also plenty of restaurants within walking distance.  The hotel has charm, a very Southern California feel to it.  The rooms were small and the bathrooms need to be updated but that's what "old" hotels are about and I was OK with that.  The biggest problem with this hotel is the cantina across the street.  This place is a hard core partying place and the noise (music and people screaming) goes on until 2:30 in the morning.    After the second night my brother and my husband decided if you can't beat 'em, then join 'em and had a great time at the cantina.  However, the rest of the family (grandparents and moms' of small children) didn't get any sleep at all.  I

This hotel has the best location.  It's a block from the beach on one side and a short walk to the ferry on the other (if you're going to Balboa Island).  It's near many resturants, shops and bike rentals.  We stayed on a Monday so the noise at night wasn't too bad.  There is no hotel parking, but there is a public lot very close by (for the beach)at $8.00 a day. And yes they do have an energy surcharge of a few bucks.  Wireless internet is available for $10.00 a day.  Lobby internet, I think was 50 cents a minute. The hotel is old and not well kept up.  At least in our room, the television does not face the bed (nor could it be moved), so you have to watch at an angle.  The tub however was deep and wide, perfect for soaking. Now I know why my mom used to tell me never to judge a book by its cover.  This Inn is charming on the outside, but your real journey begins after check in.  I don't mind old and quaint, but little and dirty aren't my style. One daughter's bed linens had brown stains on them and she had to request that the room be cleaned again before she would check -in.  My other daughter was awakened early one morning and told the room below hers  was leaking water from the ceiling.  Since no one was showering in her room at the time, she assumed there was a mistake.  However, when she arose she discovered her rug was saturated with water that was seeping through the light fixture in her ceiling!! Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  It is very noisy.  With a cantina across the street and  the lobby bar/restaurant turned into a nightclub there was partying, cursing, fighting and people running up and down the halls until early every morning.  The advertised continental breakfast never started without me first going to the front desk and reminding them to set it up (at least 30 minutes late every morning.)  One morning I even found the lobby employee asleep at the front desk.  One member of my party had water leaking from her ceiling and another had their water turned off without notice.  Don't even bother complaining to the management who made no effort to rectify the problems or satisfy their patrons were paying over $200 a night.

My fiance and I chose this hotel to avoid the bland 'corporate' alternatives for our wedding and reception.  We couldn't have made a worse choice. Our guests were all in tiny, dirty, uncomfortable no A/C rooms.  They "accidentally" gave someone else the bridal suite and refused to discount alternative room directly above noisy street and bar.  Many of our guests checked out and went to alternate hotels. They began framing construction on the new addition the day before what was supposed to be our oceanview rooftop ceremony then refused to give us ANY type of concessions.  We were forced to relocate our ceremony to the street level park across from the hotelthe evening before the wedding. While a faded glory hotel is just fine with me, this one is trading on long faded reality. This place appears relatively, and I mean relatively, moderate. But, watch out, it nickel and dimes you to death. Instead of installing energy efficient devices like compact fluorescent lightbulbs, they charge you $3.50/day for "energy use.' The local calls, I found out the hard way, are over $3 each. The rooms badly need a facelift, althought if you get one with a balcony, you do have a little view of the ocean above a very noisy street.

We spent the Thanksgiving Holiday here.  I was a little leary after reading reviews, but decided to give it a try.  This area is paradise in November.  The crowds are gone, the hotel was quiet and the beach beautiful.  The room was old, as is the hotel, but it was clean.  Breakfast overlooking the boardwalk was a treat.  Loved walks on the beach in the morning.  Look forward to returning next year.

The good thing about the Balboa Inn is its location, right across from the pier and within close walking distance of the ferry and several nice restaurants.  When we checked in, we were "upgraded."  I would have hated to have seen the other room as our "better" room was so small we had to put one suitcase on the closet floor and the other on the desk (which conveniently had no chair).  The continental breakfast, included in the rate, consisted of cold coffee, green tea bags ... usually the hot water was gone by the time we arrived, something that looked like orange juice, cereal, fruit, and some very good muffins. We even had a fireplace in our room!  I stay all over for business and I personally thought the rooms are very clean (I read in another review that they were not).  I am sure I will visit there again in the summer.

From the wonderful and friedly staff to the beautiful architecture and top location I had one of my best vacations at this hotel.  One of the best Italian restaurants and most delicious food. YUMMY!!!

Wonderfull location on the beach, romantic ambience,  great Italian food, biking and deep sea fishing.  Walking distance to Catalina Island Ferry. Enjoyd our trip especially great for kids. A+ in my book. The previous user reviewer must be talking about a different hotel, this one is fantastic. My Kids can't wait to go back and enjoy the beach.

Very run down. I half expected hookers to knock on my door in the middle of the night. Which may be a left over from when Wilt Camberlain owned it. This is by far the worst place I have even stayed in my life. It seems that management has not put any money into the upkeep for years. They make a good income scamming unsuspecting tourist-because even if you do not stay they charge you $50.
